message: Tomorrow at  The American Center - Ho Chi Minh City: If you are heading to the U.S. to study in the fall, check out this great event we’re hosting to help you prepare.  Create a network of contacts while enjoying some coffee! Useful guide books and cool door prizes are available on a first-come, first-served basis.  Don't miss!

Are you beginning your studies at an American university this fall? Join us to learn how to best prepare for your departure. Consular Officers, EducationUSA Advisors, American students and local alumni will discuss travel planning, adjusting to life in the U.S., F1 visa rules, and American social and academic culture. This interactive session will also provide you an opportunity to meet other students travelling to various universities in the U.S. Create a network of contacts while enjoying some coffee! Useful guide books and cool door prizes are available on a first-come, first-served basis.
 
The event is free of charge. Prior registration is strongly advised. Email HCMCEDUSA@state.gov.

Check out the Fulbright YSEALI Summer School. Sponsored by the U.S. Mission to Vietnam and the Fulbright Economics Teaching Program http://goo.gl/c6ngqu. The application deadline is 5:00PM, Sunday June 21, 2015. Don't miss it!

Film Screening and Discussion: “Heaven and Earth”
Time: Monday June 15, 4:00 – 7:00 p.m.
Speaker: Le Ly Hayslip, Guest speaker

An Oliver Stone movie, “Heaven and Earth” tells the true story of a Vietnamese village girl, Le Ly, who survives a life of hardship during and after the Vietnam War. After emigrating to the United States, she faces new challenges. Come join the film screening and participate in a discussion with Le Ly about her life story.

MOOC Camp: Analyzing Global Trends for Business and Society – Session 5
Time: Tuesday, June 16, 5:30 - 7:00 p.m.
Speaker: Phan Dinh Tuan Anh, Guest Speaker 

Participate in this session and discuss global trends with other participants. Don’t forget to review the online materials before attending this session!

MOOC Camp: Introduction to Public Speaking – Closing Ceremony
Time: Wednesday, June 17, 5:00 – 7:00 p.m.
Speaker: Chris Helmkamp, Consulate Officer

After weeks of online learning and practical experience at the American Center, it is time for you to celebrate your achievement. Come share how the learning opportunity has transformed your public speaking skills.

LGBT Pride Month: HIV and Healthy Living for LGBT (in Vietnamese)
Time: Thursday, June 18, 2:00 – 4:00 p.m.
Speaker: Nguyen Anh Phong, Vietnam National Network of People Living with HIV 

This session will address issues related to HIV prevention and the challenges faced by LGBT people with HIV. Expert Nguyen Anh Phong and insiders will share stories to help build awareness and create a more healthy and inclusive community.

MOOC Camp: Shaping the Way We Teach English, Part 2 – Session 4
Time: Thursday, June 18, 5:30 - 7:00 p.m.
Speaker: Caroline Nabors, English Language Fellow 

This session is for invited participants. Don’t forget to review the online materials before attending the discussion!

LGBT Pride Month: Documentary Film Screening “The Last Journey of Madame Phung”
Time: Friday, June 19, 9:30 – 11:30 a.m.
Speaker: Nguyen Thi Tham, director

If you missed the first screening of “The Last Journey of Madame Phung” in May, come join the encore presentation of this heart-warming documentary on transgender issues. The film is in Vietnamese with English subtitles. Following the screening, we will have an open discussion with the documentary’s director, Nguyen Thi Tham, who will share stories from behind the scenes and answer your questions.

Adolescent Decision Making: Going It on Your Own at College
Time: Friday, June 19, 2:00 – 4:00 p.m.
Speaker: Dr. Neal Newfield, West Virginia University

Parents who have children going off to college will find this program interesting and relevant. Dr. Newfield will examine the adolescent decision-making process, inherent risks, and how to better prepare your child for the decisions they will face in college.

Book Club Activities
Time: Monday, June 8, 5:30 – 7:00 p.m.
Speaker: Kristen Weaver, Consulate Officer 

Book club is now back at the American Center! Join us on every second Monday of the month to read, discuss, and discover American culture through contemporary short stories. Our June book club will introduce you to short, humorous stories in “Me Talk Pretty One Day,” written by American author David Sedaris. Bring your friends and get ready to learn more about American sense of humor!

Applying for Graduate Students in the United States: Choosing, Applying and Financing
Time: Tuesday, June 9, 2:00 – 4:00 p.m.
Speaker: Sandarshi Gunawardena, VEF Senior Program Officer 

If you have finished your undergraduate studies and would like to apply for graduate study in the U.S., this presentation will provide you some important insights in to choosing the right institution that fits your academic preparation and the desired field of study; the application process to graduate schools in the U.S, including general admission requirements for international students.; and some strategies to secure financial support for graduate studies.

message: A U.S. education can give you the skills necessary to be an effective leader in your career and your community. What do you think makes a good leader?  https://goo.gl/jxw0a6

Want to turn your business vision into a reality? On June 4 at 7 pm Vietnam Time, we’re hosting the latest interactive web chat in our #EntrExchange series, “Raising Capital: Trends & Innovations.” Two dynamic speakers will help #ExchangeAlumni find funds to launch, sustain, and expand business ventures.  With the hashtag #EntrExchange, you can start asking questions, and meet other program guests, on social media now. Learn more about the program here: https://goo.gl/iV7Ebl.

Seven YSEALI Professional Fellows from Vietnam joined the Town Hall with President Obama at the White House on June 1, 2015. They asked how the President expects the young people in Southeast Asian countries to address current challenges to peace, stability, and respect to international law, while promoting the cooperation between the 10 countries and with others, particularly with the United States as well as the current issues in Asia. To hear President Obama’s responses, click here 
https://www.whitehouse.gov/photos-and-video/video/2015/06/01/president-speaks-young-southeast-asian-leaders-initiative-fellows

Buổi thảo luận thứ sáu của khoá học MOOC Camp: Introduction to Public Speaking sẽ diễn ra vào lúc 5 p.m. chiều nay. Các bạn nhớ đến sớm chút để tránh phải chờ đợi lâu khi vào cổng nhé. Hẹn gặp các bạn tại AC!

Tháng sáu hàng năm là Tháng Tự hào của Người đồng tính, song tính, và chuyển giới (LGBT). Tại AC sẽ tổ chức một loạt chương trình bao gồm các buổi nói chuyện chuyên đề, triển lãm, chiếu phim. Vào lúc 2 p.m. chiều nay là chương trình đầu tiên, khởi động cho chuỗi hoạt động này. Các bạn đừng bỏ lỡ nhé!

message: Hãy đến tham dự sự kiện "Hội trại tuyển chọn toàn quốc của Jr. NBA (Liên đoàn Bóng rổ Mỹ)" tại Crescent Mall, vào ngày 31/5/2015 từ 1 p.m. - 5 p.m. để giao lưu cùng Mason Plumlee, vận động viên NBA của đội Brooklyn Nets, và nhận những phần quà hấp dẫn.

On June 1st at 18:10 UTC (June 2nd, 1:10 Vietnam Time), President Obama will host the 2015 White House Event with YSEALI Fellows in Washington D.C.  Follow the White House livestream and on Twitter at #YSEALI! http://go.wh.gov/YSEALIevent
Các bạn lưu ý, tuần này AC không có chương trình nào cả vì trung tâm phải phục vụ sự kiện nội bộ. Các chương trình MOOC camps hàng tuần sẽ bắt đầu lại vào tuần sau.

Good news for AC members! Check it out!

As part of World Environmental Day activities, the U.S. Consulate General in HCMC in partnership with Intel Vietnam, AmCham, and the World Wide Fund will co-organize the Green Bike 2015 event with the theme “Love our Forest, Love our Planet”. As American Center’s members, you are invited to join the event. The first 150 members to register will be selected.

Event: GREEN BIKE 2015 – LOVE OUR FOREST, LOVE OUR PLANET!
Venue: CR4, Crescent Mall, District 7, Ho Chi Minh City
Date: Saturday, May 30th, 2015, 6:30 a.m. - 10:00 a.m.

Note: T-Shirts, Caps, Breakfast and Bikes will be provided. If you plan to bring your own bike, please indicate that clearly in the registration, so that we can save bikes for others. You have to be AC members to register for this event. AC will send a confirmation to you. Register here: https://goo.gl/2bTzrX

The American Center will be closed on May 25th, 2015 in observance of Memorial Day. The Center will also be closed on Thursday, May 28th and Friday, May 29th for internal events. Read more about Memorial Day here: http://www.usa.gov/Topics/Memorial-Day.shtml

Trung tâm Hoa Kỳ đóng cửa nghĩ lễ Mỹ vào ngày thứ hai, 25/5 và ngày thứ năm 28/5, thứ sáu 29/5 cho sự kiện nội bộ. Mời các bạn đọc thêm thông tin về ngày lễ Mỹ Memorial Day ở đây: http://www.usa.gov/Topics/Memorial-Day.shtml

Interested in exchange programs? Check out the YSEALI Professional Fellows on Economic Empowerment Program with American Councils http://goo.gl/xCQ1mV

To apply for this program, you need to complete an online application found at: http://ais.americancouncils.org. Applications must be submitted by June 1, 2015 4:00 PM Washington DC time (4:00AM June 2, 2015 Vietnam time) to be considered for the fall 2015 program. Applications submitted after the deadline will not be considered.

Conversation Hour with American Students
Time: Friday, May 22, 3:30 – 5:00 p.m
Speaker: Missouri State University Students

Missouri State University is a public university located in the American Midwest. Students from MSU will be visiting Ho Chi Minh City, and would like to talk with American Canter patrons about their experiences and yours! Come join an open and interactive conversation that promises to be great fun.

Talk Show: Asian American Heritage Month
Time: Friday, May 22, 5:30 – 7:00 p.m
Speakers: Consulate Officers

May is Asian-Pacific American Heritage Month, paying tribute to the generations of Asian and Pacific Islanders who have enriched America’s history and are instrumental to the country’s future success. Come join Consulate officers in their talk and sharing stories about the contributions and achievements of Asian Americans in the United States. Bring your questions!

message: Thông báo: Buổi thảo luận tiếp theo của MOOC Public Speaking sẽ diễn ra vào Thứ Hai, 18/5/2015 lúc 5:00g chiều. Sẽ không có buổi thảo luận vào ngày Thứ Tư, 20/5 như thông báo trước đó vì chúng tôi có sự kiện nội bộ. Xin lỗi về sự thay đổi này. Hẹn gặp các bạn vào Thứ Hai!

Chiều nay lúc 16g sẽ có buổi chiếu phim "Chuyến Đi Cuối Cùng của Chị Phụng" tại Trung Tâm Hoa Kỳ. Sau khi xem phim, khán giả sẽ giao lưu cùng đạo diễn Nguyễn Thị Thắm. Vì số lượng khán giả đăng ký xem phim đông, các bạn vui lòng đến sớm 15 phút để check-in và ổn định chỗ ngồi. Để đảm bảo chất lượng buổi chiếu phim, chúng tôi sẽ không tiếp nhận khách 20 phút sau khi chương trình bắt đầu. Hẹn gặp mọi người chiều nay!

Finding good mentors is key to an early-stage entrepreneur’s success. On May 27, 60 young entrepreneurs from ASEAN will land in Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam for the 5-day  #YSEALI Generation: Power of Entrepreneurship regional exchange. Each participant will be connected with an experienced mentor who has a wealth of resources, connections and experience to share. A big thank you to our mentors, Hilary Blair, Fiona Macaulay, Pat Cuartero, Douglas Ma, Ellyne Lamin, Sarah Green, David Gardner and Lillian Diaz for their commitment to developing the next generation of successful entrepreneurs.

On May 12, Ambassador Osius visited Le Hong Phong High School for the Gifted and led a conversation about the various areas in which Vietnam and the U.S. have cooperated over the past 20 years.  The students had exciting opinions to share about how Vietnam and the U.S. can help each other grow even further in the next 20 years.  Which school should the Ambassador visit next time he’s in town?

MOOC Camp: Analyzing Global Trends for Business and Society (May 4 – July 7)

Learn how to spot fast-changing trends and the consequences they can have for markets, businesses, and society with the new MOOC Camp: “Analyzing Global Trends for Business and Society”. Starting on May 4, 2015 and running for seven weeks, this course is offered by the University of Pennsylvania and taught by Professor Mauro Guillén. Participants need to create a Coursera account and register for the course online at: https://www.coursera.org/course/globaltrends.

Participants who send proof of online course completion to achcmc@state.gov by July 5 and attend six out of seven weekly discussions at the American Center will receive a certificate of completion.

Mother’s Day in the United States is celebrated each year on the second Sunday in May. In millions of households, mothers will be honored with flowers, greeting cards, candy, a special cake and, perhaps, breakfast in bed or a special lunch or dinner at a restaurant.

message: Young entrepreneurs from across ASEAN are getting ready for the May 27 kick-off of #YSEALI Generation: Power of Entrepreneurship in Ho Chi Minh City. From more than 1,400 applications, the final 60 participants will come together for a 5-day workshop develop their venture ideas and build a network of peers and mentors that spans the region.

We are excited to announce that the application period for the 2015 YSEALI Professional Fellows Program is now open! You can get the program details and apply here http://hochiminh.usconsulate.gov/2015-yseali-professional-fellows-program.html

The YSEALI Professional Fellows Program is a professional development exchange program for the best and brightest community leaders from all across the ASEAN region. If selected as a Fellow, you have the opportunity to participate in a month-long program at a U.S.-based local government office, business, non-profit organization or legislative office. Fellows also work with community leaders to enhance their practical expertise, leadership skills and professional contacts to address issues in their home communities.

Special Advisor on Disability Rights Judy Heumann, a longstanding leader in the fight for equal rights, led a discussion on the film "Lives Worth Living." What can you do to help make your communities more accessible for everyone? Let us know in the comments!

Hãy đến tham dự buổi chiếu phim “Những cuộc đời đáng sống” và giao lưu với bà Judith Heumann, Cố vấn đặc biệt của Ngoại trưởng Hoa Kỳ John Kerry về quyền của người khuyết tật vào lúc 3g ngày thứ hai, 4/5 tại trung tâm Hoa Kỳ. Tại chương trình này, Bà Judith Heumann với vai trò là một nhà hoạt động bảo vệ quyền của người khuyết tật cũng là một trong những nhân vật xuất hiện trong phim sẽ thảo luận về bộ phim và giao lưu với khán giả. message:
America's Race: The Kentucky Derby

The Kentucky Derby is a Grade I stakes race for three year-old Thoroughbred horses, held annually in Louisville, Kentucky, on the first Saturday in May. At Louisville’s Churchill Downs, the world's fastest thoroughbred horses have competed on the first Saturday of every May since 1875. Known as the Kentucky Derby, this race is the oldest continuously held sporting event in the United States and one of the most prestigious in the world. Read more: http://goo.gl/krItrz

message:
Hãy đến Trung tâm Hoa Kỳ để cùng chúng tôi chào đón Nghệ sĩ Saxophone Trần Mạnh Tuấn và đại diện các công ty trong lĩnh vực giải trí để kỷ niệm Ngày Sở hữu Trí tuệ Thế giới năm 2015. Vì chủ đề được đưa ra trên toàn cầu năm nay là “Hãy thức tỉnh và hành động vì âm nhạc”, nghệ sĩ Trần Mạnh Tuấn sẽ trình diễn một vài tiết mục bắt đầu lúc 15 giờ 30 và cùng tham gia buổi thảo luận về tầm quan trọng của việc bảo vệ sở hữu trí tuệ nhằm thúc đẩy sáng tạo và phát triển kinh tế. Tùy viên khu vực thuộc Cơ quan Sáng chề và Nhãn hiệu Hoa Kỳ Peter Fowler, một chuyên gia về sở hữu trí tuệ của Chính phủ Hoa Kỳ, sẽ từ Bangkok sang để điều phối buổi thảo luận này.
 
Thời gian: 15:30-16:45, Thứ Hai, 20/04
Địa điểm: Trung tâm Hoa Kỳ, Lầu 8, Diamond Plaza, 34 Lê Duẩn, Quận 1

Please join us at the American Center as we welcome renowned Saxophonist Tran Manh Tuan, and entertainment industry representatives to celebrate World Intellectual Property Day 2015.  As part of this year’s global theme “Get up, stand up. For Music”, Mr. Tuan will perform a short setlist beginning at 15:30 and will then join a panel discussion on the importance of intellectual property protection as a driver for creativity and economic growth.  U.S. Patent and Trademark Office Regional Attaché Peter Fowler, a U.S. Government expert on intellectual property, will join us from Bangkok to moderate the discussion.
 
When: 15:30-16:45, Monday, April 20
Where: American Center, 8th Floor, Diamond Plaza, 34 Le Duan, District 1

message:
This time-lapse map makes it clear that our planet is rapidly getting warmer. Nine of the Earth’s warmest years since 1880 have occurred after 2000. (The 10th warmest year? 1998.) Scientists from NASA’s Goddard Institute for Space Studies, who released this analysis, warn that record-breaking temperatures could occur over the next two to three years.
https://share.america.gov/climate-change-speeding-watch-temperature-planet-rise-draft/

All mammals, including people, need air, water and food to survive. Arctic marine mammals need one more thing: ice, and a lot of it. A range of Arctic animals face a precarious future with the well-documented loss of sea ice at the top of the world.
https://share.america.gov/less-arctic-ice-less-arctic-life/

Các bạn lưu ý khóa học online về Public Speaking đã bắt đầu ngày 7/4.  Buổi thảo luận đầu tiên ở AC sẽ vào thứ tư tuần sau 15/4, lúc 5g chiều. Các bạn phải đăng ký theo học khóa online và dự buổi thảo luận tại AC theo 2 đường link dưới đây.  Bạn nào chưa đăng ký thì nhanh chóng đăng ký ngay nhé vì số lượng tham dự có hạn. The American Center is pleased to announce a new MOOC Camp: Introduction to Public Speaking. This ten-week course, beginning on April 7, 2015, is designed to help you become a more effective and confident public speaker. The course is offered by the University of Washington and taught by Dr. Matt McGarrity. Participants who complete the online course and attend 7 out of 8 weekly discussions will receive a certificate of completion.
Register for the online course here: http://goo.gl/y8BPPY
Register for discussion sessions at the American Center here: http://goo.gl/DYJU0o

Hôm nay là ngày đầu tiên của Chuỗi lớp học về Kỹ năng Diễn thuyết trước khán giả của Tiến sĩ Patricia Goodman (ĐH Northeastern)! Trong tháng này, AC còn có MOOC camp: Introduction to Public Speaking đã bắt đầu ngày 7/4. Các bạn hãy nhanh chóng đăng ký ngay hôm nay nhé http://goo.gl/y8BPPY.

Bật mí với cả nhà là sắp tới AC sẽ có một cuộc thi thuyết trình để các bạn có thể áp dụng những kỹ năng học hỏi được từ chuỗi tập huấn và MOOC camp về kỹ năng thuyết trình trong tháng 4 này. Hãy tham dự và trang bị cho mình những kiến thức cần thiết để dự thi nhé.

There are more than 7 billion people on Earth. Imagine if every one of us committed to do one thing — no matter how small — to protect wildlife every day. Even minor actions can have a major impact when we all work together. Here are ways you can make a difference: https://share.america.gov/top-10-ways-save-wildlife/

message:
Every year, thousands of animal species become extinct. Animals that once roamed the Earth in abundance are permanently disappearing from our planet at a heart-stopping pace. Scientists estimate that the current rate of extinction is 1,000 times greater than it would normally be because of one factor: humans.
https://share.america.gov/why-should-we-help-conserve-wildlife/

Sáng nay, thư viện Trung tâm Hoa Kỳ đã chính thức mở cửa hoạt động trở lại sau thời gian nâng cấp. Cám ơn tất cả các bạn đã đến trung tâm ngày hôm nay để chúc mừng, tham quan, học tập, trải nghiệm cơ sở vật chất và dịch vụ mới . This morning, the American Center's library officially reopened to the public. Thanks all for coming to celebrate, visit, study, and experience our new facilities and services. Haven't been a member yet, register now at http://goo.gl/r0PNz6  What do you think about the new AC? Please tell us.

To celebrate the reopening of the American Center this Thursday April 2nd at 10am, EducationUSA will increase the number of advising sessions per week to 4 session: Monday & Wednesday 2pm – 4pm; and Tuesday & Friday 9am – 11am. To make your appointment, please call (08)3520.4685. Welcome to our new and beautiful room of EducationUSA!

Good news! After several months of reconstruction, the American Center will officially reopen on April 2nd at 10:00 a.m.! Come see what we’ve been doing, and all the great new services that we have to offer. There will be special prizes for the first people who come through the door! Note: ID is required for entry!

message:
Trung tâm Hoa Kỳ hiện đang hỗ trợ chương trình Thiên Thần Thái Bình Dương (Operation Pacific Angel) tại địa phương và tại tỉnh Quảng Ngãi. Chương trình tập hợp các nhân viên quân đội Hoa Kỳ và Việt Nam, các chuyên gia y tế và kỹ sư, cũng như các bác sỹ thuộc lực lượng không quân Hoa Kỳ từ các nước châu Á khác. Vào thứ Hai họ sẽ hoàn tất công tác nhân đạo chú trọng về mảng y tế và kỹ thuật.

The American Center is supporting the work of Operation Pacific Angel locally and in Quang Ngai province. Pacific Angel brings together U.S. military members and their Vietnamese counterparts, along with local heath and engineering specialists, as well as air force doctors from other Asian countries. On Monday they will finish up their humanitarian work which has focused on the areas of health and engineering.

CUỘC THI VIDEO CỦA USAID DÀNH CHO SINH VIÊN: Bạn còn một tháng nữa để nộp sản phẩm tham dự cuộc thi video này và có cơ hội nhận được chiếc máy tính MacBook Air? Hãy thực hiện một đoạn video nêu được vấn đề phát triển nơi bạn đang sinh sống và đề xuất giải pháp giải quyết. Các bạn xem thêm chi tiết tại đây nhé: http://go.usa.gov/Sdx9

Mời các bạn ghi lại lịch chương trình cả tuần này tại AC nhé. Rất nhiều chương trình hay, đừng bỏ lỡ chương trình nào nhé.

[Women's History Month] Building self-confidence for women
Time: Monday, March 23, 2:00 p.m.
Speaker: Caroline Nabors, English Language Fellow 

This is a great opportunity for tips to enhance your confidence in public and professional settings. Come join Ms. Caroline Nabors in her discussion about what women can do to empower themselves.

Public Speaking Skills: Conquer Fear, Conquer English
Time: Monday, March 23, 5:00 p.m.
Speaker: Tony Ngo, E2 Co-founder and Chairman

Do you get nervous speaking English? Do you feel embarrassed before you open your mouth? Do you ever freeze up in front of a group? We'll introduce and practice techniques that can help you express your ideas confidently and persuasively, This is intended for anyone who wants to become better at English, from grade school students to adults. 

Food and You: You are more powerful than you think
Time: Tuesday, Mach 24, 2:00 p.m.
Speaker: Robert Lucius, Asia Pacific Programs, Humane Society International 

In this presentation, we will discuss relationships between personal food choices, national and global food trends, and their dietary implications for public health, climate change, the environment, animal welfare and global food security. You’ll learn why the food you eat matters in more ways that you realize, and how you can change the world with your chopsticks.

[MOOC Camp – How to Learn] Discussion Session 2 – How to Learn: Powerful Mental Tools to Help You Master Tough Subjects
Time: Tuesday, March 24, 5:30 p.m.
Speaker: Tuan Anh, facilitator 

[Women’s History Month] Reflection on Gender: Let’s Talk about You
Time: Wednesday, March 25, 2:00 p.m.
Speaker: Ms. Marianne Oehlers, UNICEF

Have you ever thought or asked yourself “What does equality mean?”, “What are the roles of men and women in society?”, or “Why can my sibling do things I can’t?, then this is the event for you. During this presentation, we will ask you to be the leader. We will spend time exploring what is understood about gender, what it means to you, your peers, and your community. The goal is to start a thought-provoking and open conversation between young people to see what we can do together in 2015.

[Soft Skills Training Series] Session 4: Negotiating for salaries
Time: Wednesday, March 25, 5:00 p.m.
Speaker: Minh Do, Editor at Tech In Asia

Need tips on how to discuss your salary with an employer? This session with Mr. Minh Do will help you learn how to do it right when negotiating. 

[Entrepreneurship Workshop] Understanding Entrepreneurship
Date: Thursday, March 26, 5:30 p.m.
Speaker: Esther Nguyen

Plan to start a business? Come join entrepreneur Esther Nguyen to learn about entrepreneurship and startups. Esther will cover what it takes to make a great entrepreneur and share examples of great entrepreneurs in Vietnam. 

[Women's History Month] American Classic's Film Series: Adam’s Rib
Date: Thursday, March 26, 5:00 p.m.
Speaker: Chris Helmkamp, Consulate Officer 

Calling all movie lovers: The American Classics Film Series has been on hiatus during the AC renovation, but we’re back with an even bigger, better cinematic experience! Join us in Women’s History Month to screen and discuss a 1949 comedy about the rapidly changing role of women in American society after World War II.

[Women's History Month] Empowering Women through Dancing
Date: Friday, March 27, 2:00 p.m.
Speaker: Emily Navarra, Dance Artist 

[Women's History Month] Weaving the Stories of Women’s Lives
Date: Friday, March 27, 5:00 p.m.
Speaker: Pilar Quigua, Consulate Officer

March marks Women's History Month, highlighting the stories of women's life, their choices, and the achievements. Come hear inspiring stories and continue to tell the world who women are and what they can accomplish today.
Do you think protesting is an effective tool to bring about social change? Why or why not? http://goo.gl/o0Qkve
Great things happen when Tech Women get together! How women and girls be encouraged to pursue tech careers? http://goo.gl/Q1NQjn

Chiều nay tại AC có 2 chương trình. Lúc 2 p.m. là chương trình hướng dẫn cho các bạn nữ cách ăn uống lành mạnh và cách cân bằng trong cuộc sống. Các bạn còn được học một số động tác yoga căn bản vào cuối chương trình. 

Lúc 5:30 p.m. là buổi đầu tiên của khóa học trực tuyến Phương pháp học tập hiệu quả, các bạn nhớ đăng ký trên Coursera trước nhé https://www.coursera.org/learn/learning-how-to-learn

[Women's History Month] Healthy Eating and Life Balance for Women (women only)
Speaker: Tran Lan Huong, Health Coach

MOOC Camp – How to Learn: Powerful Mental Tools to Help You Master Tough Subjects
Speaker: Tuan Anh, facilitator
Did you know that Michelle Obama always finds 90 minutes each day to exercise? Check out these surprising facts to learn more about the First Lady. http://goo.gl/u8BZuS

Các bạn ghi lại lịch chương trình tuần sau tại AC nhé. Nổi bật là các chương trình kỉ niệm Tháng Lịch sử Phụ nữ (các bạn nam vẫn tham gia được, trừ những chương trình có ghi chú dành riêng cho nữ), MOOC có khoá học mới về Phương pháp học thế nào cho hiệu quả, chương trình kĩ năng mềm buổi thứ ba về kĩ năng trả lời phỏng vấn.

[Women's History Month] Healthy Eating and Life Balance for Women (women only)
Date: Tuesday, March 17, 2:00 p.m.
Speaker: Tran Lan Huong, Health Coach 

If you care about your health, mind, and body, join coach Tran Lan Huong for an open discussion about strategies to help women stay healthy and active. After the talk, coach Huong will introduce you to some quick yoga exercises which you can practice before and after work. Participate for a more healthy life!

MOOC Camp – How to Learn: Powerful Mental Tools to Help You Master Tough Subjects
Time: Tuesday, March 17, 5:30 – 7:00 p.m.
Speaker: Tuan Anh, facilitator

This course gives you easy access to  invaluable learning techniques used by experts in art, music, math, science, sports, and other disciplines. We’ll learn about the how the brain uses two very different learning modes and how it encapsulates (“chunks”) information. We’ll also cover illusions of learning, memory techniques, dealing with procrastination, and best practices shown by research to be the most effective in helping you master tough subjects.

This MOOC Camp includes five sessions on Tuesdays, from March 17 to April 14. Participants are required to register for the MOOC course on Coursera https://www.coursera.org/learn/learning-how-to-learn, review materials and lessons before each MOOC Discussion meeting, complete all quizzes and final test, and attend at least four discussion meetings, in order to receive a certificate of completion.

[Soft Skills Training Series] Session 3: Interviewing Skills
Time: Wednesday, March 18, 5:00 – 6:30 p.m.
Speaker: Bennett Lowenthal, Consulate Officer 

Dealing with questions at a job interview can be nerve-wracking. This session will discuss what you need to prepare, and how to successfully tackle employers’ questions, as well as how to raise smart questions. This series consists of 4 sessions and one team project.  Participants who attend all sessions and join the team project will receive a certificate of completion. 

Completing an Internship in the U.S.: Curricular Practical Training (CPT) and Optional Practical Training (OPT)
Date: Thursday, March 19, 2:00 – 4:00 p.m.
Speaker: Vickie Kuester, University of Wisconsin-Stout 

This presentation will introduce young people to the American polytechnic model of education. A polytechnic education in the States is an engaging, active, applied learning experience that incorporates both theory and research. American polytechnic universities focus on professional, career-oriented programs in a wide range of disciplines from the fine arts to engineering. Graduates of polytechnics enjoy an extremely high employment rate, so this presentation will conclude with an exploration of some of the unique majors that polytechnic institutions offer.

[Women's History Month] A Male Perspective
Date: Thursday, March 19, 5:30pm
Speaker: Abraham Lee, Consulate Officer 

Hear an Asian-American view on the different roles of men and women in both domestic and professional settings. This informal and interactive discussion with Consulate Officer Abraham Lee will cover women, roles, dating, family and more. Bring questions if you have any!

[Women's History Month] Empowering female students in schools
Date: Friday, March 20, 3:00 – 5:00 p.m.
Speakers: Students from Indiana University

Using Online Tools and Digital Resources
Speaker: Caroline Nabors, English Language Fellow

[Teen Tech Week] Libraries are for Making: Social Media Safety tips
Speaker: Bennett Lowenthal, Consulate Officer

Do you know that information posted on social media platforms such as Facebook, Twitter, Tumblr can be a threat to you and your family? Come join us for a workshop on cyber safety tips to be a smart social media user in the digital age.

[Workshop Series] Starting a Successful Non-Profit Organization in Asia
Speaker: Tom Stader, Executive Director & Founder of The Library Project 

Join Mr. Tom Stader as he reviews a start-up checklist for starting a non-profit organization in Asia and discusses how to make it successful.
Extend your student visa in the U.S. with this program. Are you a current or former student? Tell us about your experience! http://goo.gl/qpG1DQ

Muốn trở thành Kỹ sư? Và muốn tìm hiểu về các cơ hội nghề nghiệp dành cho Du học sinh? Hẹn gặp các bạn tại buổi hội thảo chiều nay!

Study Engineering in the USA and Career Prospects for International Students

Time: Wednesday, March 11, 2:00 – 4:00 p.m.
Speaker: Nicole H. Harris Sealey, George Mason University

Are you interested in studying engineering in the United States? Do you wonder how to maximize your career prospects after earning an engineering degree? Talk with Nicole Sealey, the INTO Mason Academic Director and former Director of Graduate Admissions for the Volgenau School of Engineering at George Mason University, as she shares insights about major options in the U.S., the potential of minor subjects to enhance your degree, and what you need to know to prepare yourself for an undergraduate or graduate degree abroad.

https://www.eventbrite.com/e/teen-tech-week-study-engineering-in-the-usa-and-career-prospects-for-international-students-tickets-16011575052

Các bạn đừng bỏ lỡ chương trình rất thú vị tiếp theo trong "Tuần Công Nghệ dành cho Giới Trẻ," vào 2 p.m. hôm nay nhé. Chương trình sẽ được thực hiện bằng tiếng Việt và không yêu cầu bạn có hiểu biết về lập trình, nên ai cũng có thể tham dự được. Hẹn gặp tất cả các bạn.

[Teen Tech Week] Libraries are for Making: Programming from Scratch

Scratch, developed at the Massachusetts Institute of Technology, is a computer programming language that makes it very easy and fun for everyone to create interactive stories, songs, and games. Come join us to see computer programming is not as complicated as you thought and explore how easy and cool it can be! Bring your own laptop for your convenience. No previous programming knowledge or pre-installed software required. The only thing you need to know is how to ‘drag and drop’. That’s it!

Bạn luôn nghĩ mình "low-tech"? Sao bạn không đến tham dự các chương trình chủ đề công nghệ dành cho giới trẻ tại AC vào tuần sau để nâng cấp bản thân mình? Bạn không những sẽ tiếp thu được các kiến thức bổ ích mà còn được tự tay trải nghiệm, thực hành tại chỗ, và thậm chí là còn có quà để mang về nữa đó.

[Teen Tech Week] Libraries are for Making: Using Online Tools and Digital Resources
Time: Monday, March 9, 2:00 – 4:00 p.m.
Speaker: Caroline Nabors, English Language Fellow 

This event marks the opening of Teen Tech Week with an insightful discussion on how to make the best use of online tools and digital resources. Come join Ms. Caroline Nabors, who will introduce you to a comprehensive list of tools empowering English learners, as well as tips on how to effectively turn channels such as podcasts and YouTube into powerful tools for knowledge. Bring your friends! The more, the merrier.

[Teen Tech Week] Libraries are for Making: Programing from Scratch
Time: Tuesday, March 10, 2:00 – 4:00 p.m.
Speaker: Le Dac Minh, American Center Technical Specialist 

Scratch, developed at the Massachusetts Institute of Technology, is a computer programing language that makes it very easy and fun for everyone to create interactive stories, songs, and games. Come join us to see computer programming is not as complicated as you thought and explore how easy and cool it can be! Bring your own laptop for your convenience. No previous programing knowledge or pre-installed software required. The only thing you need to know is how to ‘drag and drop’. That’s it!

[Teen Tech Week] Study Engineering in the USA and Career Prospects for International Students
Time: Wednesday, March 11, 2:00 – 4:00 p.m.
Speaker: Nicole H. Harris Sealey, George Mason University 

Are you interested in studying engineering in the United States? Do you wonder how to maximize your career prospects after earning an engineering degree? Talk with Nicole Sealey, the INTO Mason Academic Director and former Director of Graduate Admissions for the Volgenau School of Engineering at George Mason University, as she shares insights about major options in the U.S., the potential of minor subjects to enhance your degree, and what you need to know to prepare yourself for an undergraduate or graduate degree abroad.

[Soft Skills Training Series] Session 2: Elevator Pitch
Date: March 11, 5:00 – 6:30 p.m.
Speaker: Andy Allen, Consulate Office 

Learn how to make the most out of a first impression! Get tips on how to highlight your portfolios and make yourself outstanding among a pool of job seekers. This is the session for you. Come, learn, and practice!

[Teen Tech Week] Libraries are for Making: Social Media Safety tips
Date: Thursday, March 12, 2:00 – 4:00 p.m.
Speaker: Bennett Lowenthal, Acting PAO 

Do you know that information posted on social media platforms such as Facebook, Twitter, Tumblr can be a threat to you and your family? Come join us for a workshop on cyber safety tips to be a smart social media user in the digital age.

[Workshop Series] Starting a Successful Non-Profit Organization in Asia
Date: Thursday, March 12, 5:00 p.m.
Speaker: Tom Stader, Executive Director & Founder of The Library Project 

Join Mr. Tom Stader as he reviews a start-up checklist for starting a non-profit organization in Asia and discusses how to make it successful.

[Teen Tech Week] Libraries are for Making: Basic Photography – Tech Fair
Date: Friday, March 13, 1:00 – 5:00 p.m.
Speaker: Nguyen Thanh Tung, Guest Speaker 

Click, click, click!  If you are a beginner in photography, or simply want to improve the quality of your photos, this is an opportunity for you!  We encourage anyone interested in cameras, photography, and photo shooting to participate in the last event of the Teen Tech Week.  Learn, practice, and click away!

Nhân ngày Quốc Tế Phụ Nữ, AC chúc các bạn nữ thật nhiều niềm vui, hạnh phúc và thành công trong cuộc sống.

Nhằm tôn vinh vai trò và những đóng góp của người phụ nữ, trong tháng 3 này, AC sẽ tổ chức rất nhiều chương trình, hoạt động đặc biệt về phụ nữ. Các bạn hãy thường xuyên cập nhật Facebook, hoặc Eventbrite http://www.eventbrite.com/o/the-american-center-ho-chi-minh-city-6417029961 để không bỏ lỡ nhé.

Dàn hợp xướng của Học viện Phillips Exeter và Dàn nhạc thính phòng đại diện cho Học viện và bang New Hampshire sẽ có buổi biểu diễn tại Nhạc viện TP.HCM (112 Nguyễn Du, Quận 1) vào ngày 19/3/2015, 7:30 tối. 
Buổi hòa nhạc nằm trong chuỗi sự kiện kỉ niệm 20 năm bình thường hóa quan hệ Việt - Mỹ và mở cửa miễn phí cho công chúng. Mời các bạn đến Nhạc viện TP.HCM để nhận vé mời tham dự.

message: Cùng tham gia để có cơ hội nhận được giải thưởng thật hấp dẫn nhé!!!

Thông báo:

Chiều nay 5:30 p.m. là buổi cuối cùng của khóa MOOC: Grow to Greatness, phần 2.  Các bạn nào chưa gửi kết quả thi cuối khóa cho AC thì nhanh chóng gửi vào sáng nay ACHCMC@state.gov để AC chuẩn bị giấy chứng nhận cho các bạn. Sau lễ tổng kết hôm nay, AC sẽ không giải quyết bất cứ khiếu nại nào về giấy chứng nhận nữa.  Các bạn học phần 1 chưa nhận được giấy chứng nhận do nghỉ tết thì vui lòng chiều nay đến dự lễ để nhận luôn nhé. Cám ơn các bạn!

message:
Chuỗi chương trình tập huấn kĩ năng mềm tháng 3 sẽ trang bị cho các bạn sinh viên những kĩ năng "không thể thiếu" khi xin việc làm như trả lời phỏng vấn, thỏa thuận tiền lương, xây dựng sự nghiệp, v.v. Chuỗi tập huấn bao gồm 4 buổi học và môt buổi làm bài tập nhóm.  Tham dự đủ 5 buổi các ban sẽ nhận được giấy chứng nhận từ trung tâm.

Buổi đầu tiên sẽ diễn ra vào 5 p.m. hôm nay 4/3/2015. Do số lượng chỗ có hạn, các bạn vui lòng đến sớm.  Bàn nào có thẻ thành viên thì mang theo để giúp cho việc đăng ký tại cửa diễn ra nhanh chóng hơn.

To celebrate World Wildlife Day, Under Secretary Catherine Novelli will host a Google+ Hangout tonight at 9 p.m. - moderated by Peter Knights, Executive Director at WildAid - on wildlife trafficking around the world.
 
Hangout Participants: 
Catherine A. Novelli, Under Secretary for Economic Growth, Energy, and the Environment at the U.S. Department of State
Mr. Peter Knights, Executive Director at WildAid
Ms. Paula Kahumbu, Executive Director of Wildlife Direct
Ms. Hong Hoang, Executive Director for CHANGE
Ms. Grace Ge Gabriel, Asia Regional Director for International Fund for Animal Welfare (IFAW)

Do you have questions for the participants? Ask now at https://plus.google.com/events/cna593gkk9kc17tc8lrd6lpkh48

For more information on wildlife trafficking, please visit http://goo.gl/PMAfba and follow the conversation online by using #WorldWildlifeDay.

Chào tháng 3!  Trong tháng 3 này, AC sẽ mang đến cho các bạn nhiều chương trình hấp dẫn.  Hãy ghi lại lịch chương trình của tuần thứ nhất này và đến tham dự nhé. Hẹn gặp mọi người tại AC!

Life in Small Town America 
Time: Monday, March 2, 2:00 - 4:00 p.m.
Speaker: Karie Ennis, Guest Speaker

If the only cities you know in America are Los Angeles and New York, it's time for you to join Karie Ennis to discover the treasures and luxuries that only life in a small town can offer. You will also be surprised how small towns have made significant contributions to the American culture.

World Wildlife Day
Time: Tuesday, March 3, 2:00 – 4:00 p.m.
Speaker: Nguyen Van Quan, Guest Speaker from Education of Nature Vietnam (ENV)

March 3rd marks World Wildlife Day – a day which celebrates the intrinsic value of nature and reminds us of the urgent need to stop wildlife trafficking and other related crimes. Come learn from expert Nguyen Van Quan about current local and global wildlife issues and discuss what actions you can take to secure the future for wild plants, animals, and even yourself! 

Soft Skills Training Series: Job Searching Skills
Session 1: Building a Foundation with Entry Level Jobs
Time: Wednesday, March 4, 5:00 p.m.
Speaker: Chris Helmkamp, Consulate Officer

Are you a job seeker? Are you new to the employment world? Don't know where to start, or how to write an effective resume? Don't worry! The Soft Skills Training Series is back! This time, we offer four sessions providing students and graduates with skills, tips and knowledge for success. Join our first session on how to start your career with entry level jobs.

MOOC Camp: College Writing 2.2x – Principles of Written English, Part 2
Time: Wednesday, March 4, 5:00 p.m.
Speaker: Joe Freeman, Consulate Officer

A great opportunity for students to engage in an informal discussion on how to be a better writer. This is our last session. Don't miss it!

How the Lotus Flower Blossoms: An American's Study Abroad Experience in Vietnam
Time: Thursday, March 5, 2:00 p.m.
Speaker: Cayla Turain, American Student

Want to know about what Vietnam can offer to an American student? Come for a conversation with Cayla Turain, who will share her stories and experiences in Vietnam, and how the journey has changed her perspective about life, people, and culture.  

MOOC Camp: Growth to Greatness, Part 2
Time: Thursday, March 5, 5:30 p.m.
Speaker: Ted Nuyen, Guest Speaker

Engage in an informal discussion with Ted Nuyen and other participants. You won't want to miss the last session! Remember to send your final test results to AC by March 4. (achcmc@state.gov)

story: U.S. Consulate General - Ho Chi Minh City updated their cover photo.

message:
Chào đón các bạn trở lại sau kỳ nghỉ Tết dài!  Khởi động sau Tết, AC mang đến cho các bạn một chương trình rất hay chủ đề của tháng: tháng lịch sử người Mỹ gốc Phi với nhiều thông tin hữu ích và phần âm nhạc thú vị vào thứ tư, ngày 25/2, lúc 2 giờ chiều. Hẹn gặp mọi người tại AC!

The Myth and the Magic: Black History Month in America

Date: Wednesday, February 25, 2:00 - 4:00 p.m.
Speakers: Malikat Rufai and Cameron Thomas-Shah, Consulate Officers

You’ve probably heard of Dr. Martin Luther King, Michael Jordan, or Oprah, but how much do you really know about African-Americans? Come test your knowledge and find out more with consulate officers Malikat Rufai and Cameron Thomas-Shah, who will discuss the great contributions of African-Americans in fields such as technology, literature or music, and introduce you to examples like Charles Drew, inventor of the blood bank; the Tuskegee Airmen; or the iconic music of Motown. This event is being held in honor of Black History Month.  Get ready for a unique time at the new AC, and compete for prizes!

February is #BlackHistoryMonth in the United States! The diverse contributions of all Americans have been invaluable in helping the U.S. grow and develop. As former President Jimmy Carter said: "We have become not a melting pot but a beautiful mosaic. Different people, different beliefs, different yearnings,different hopes, different dreams." During this month we want to highlight some of the many contributions of African-Americans to the U.S. Do you know any of them?

Today is Presidents Day in the U.S. It is a U.S. federal holiday celebrated on the third Monday of February in honor of George Washington, the first president of the United States. We now also commemorate Abraham Lincoln on this holiday. Learn more about this holiday in our free resource on the #AmericanEnglish website > http://1.usa.gov/1L2xylK Do you know the names of the four presidents in the photo below? (photo courtesy of Wikipedia).

Chúc mừng năm mới 2015!  

Trung tâm Hoa Kỳ đóng cửa nghỉ tết Nguyên đán từ ngày thứ hai 16/2 đến ngày thứ hai 23/2/2015. Chúc các bạn cùng gia đình một năm mới nhiều niềm vui, hạnh phúc và may mắn. Hẹn gặp lại các bạn sau Tết nhé!

message:
Các bạn đừng quên buổi thảo luận đầu tiên của chương trình MOOC Camp: College Writing 2.2x, Part 2 vào 5 p.m. chiều nay. 

Nhớ đăng ký học trực tuyến trên edx http://tinyurl.com/nhea222 và xem trước nội dung bài học để thảo luận được hiệu quả.

Heart disease is the No. 1 killer of women and is more deadly than all forms of cancer. 1 in 3 women die of heart disease and stroke each year. Let's join us to celebrate National Wear Red Day today to help save women’s lives. And this year, Feb. 6, 2015, marks the 12th Annual National Wear Red Day.

Các bạn đừng quên chương trình Soft  Skills rất hay: Kỹ năng lãnh đạo tại AC chiều nay, thứ năm  5/2 lúc 2g nhé.  Chương trình không cần đăng ký trước nhưng rất đông.  Các bạn đi sớm để tránh phải chờ đợi.  AC sẽ chiếu phim phục vụ các bạn  trong lúc chờ đợi.  Hẹn gặp moi người tại AC nhé!

Trong thời gian này và sau Tết, mặc dù thư viện chưa sửa chữa xong nhưng AC bắt đầu tổ chức nhiều chương trình hoạt động trở lại, các bạn nhớ theo dõi facebook và đến tham dự nhé.

Chương trình mang đến những thông tin hữu ích và cập nhật nhất về du học Hoa Kỳ, các cơ hội học bổng, hỗ trợ tài chính, cũng như giải đáp các thắc mắc liên quan đến thị thực du học.

Student Visas and Studying in the United States
Time: Friday, February 6, 5:00 p.m.
Speaker: EducationUSA team

Want to study in the United States? Come join us from 5pm on Friday, Feb 6 for a special presentation on student visas and discussion with our EducationUSA team. The event will be kicked off by the State Department’s Senior Advisor for Consular Affairs, David Donahue, who will be visiting Vietnam from Washington DC. If you are wondering whether American higher education is in your future, take this opportunity to ask the experts!

Chương trình tập huấn kĩ năng lãnh đạo rất hay của tháng này vào 2 giờ chiều ngày mai. Không cần đăng ký trước, do số lượng chỗ có hạn, nên các bạn vui lòng đến sớm. Đừng bỏ lỡ!   http://www.eventbrite.com/e/soft-skills-training-leadership-skills-tickets-15611247662

Soft Skills Training: Leadership Skills
Time: Thursday, February 5, 2 p.m.
Speaker: Cameron Thomas-Shah, Consulate Officer
Join us in an informative program to learn different styles of leadership and how to step up and be an effective leader. The event is open to the public. First come, first served. No registration is required. Please come early to avoid congestion and lines.

MOOC camp: College Writing 2.2x - English Grammar and Essay Writing

Looking to improve your writing skills in English? The U.S. Embassy and The University of California, Berkeley are partnering again for the second part of the MOOC Principles of Written English. The FREE MOOC begins today, February 4th. Register here > http://tinyurl.com/nhea222

Please note when you register, there are two links: one is "pursue verified ceritifiate" (pay) and one is "Audit this course" (free). Click on the second one to register for free "Honor Code Certificate".

Discussion sessions at the American Center:
Wednesday, February 11, 5:00 p.m.
Wednesday, February 25, 5:00 p.m.

No registration is required for discussion sessions.

Video contest for Vietnamese students. Submit your entry now to win a MacBook Air (1st Prize), an iPhone 6 (2nd Prize) and a mini iPad (3rd Prize) along with certificates of recognition from USAID/Vietnam.

message: World Wetlands Day is February 2. Wetlands are home to rich biodiversity and serve important ecological functions, such as absorbing floodwaters and filtering pollutants. But according to the World Wildlife Fund, half of all wetlands have disappeared since 1900.

Black History Month Honors Legacy of Struggle and Triumph

Each February, Black History Month honors the struggles and triumphs of millions of American citizens over the most devastating obstacles — slavery, prejudice, poverty — as well as their contributions to the nation’s cultural and political life.

Take a picture that shows why English is important to you. Then, tag your photo with the hashtag #WeLoveAE on Facebook, Instagram, or Twitter, or email photos to exchangeourworld@state.gov by January 31.

American Center MOOC camp's participants joined a lunch chat with Ambassador Ted Osius and Consul General Rena Bitter on January 17 to share their experience being a member of the camp and how they found MOOC courses helpful. Join our MOOC camp if you have not done so!
story: U.S. Consulate General - Ho Chi Minh City is with Ted Nuyen and 5 others.

message:
Thông báo: Thời hạn nộp hồ sơ của chương trình Học Bổng Global UGRAD 2015 dành cho sinh viên đại học đã được dời đến 17h00, thứ Sáu, ngày 27/2/2015 để các bạn có thêm thời gian chuẩn bị hồ sơ của mình. Hãy chia sẻ cho bạn bè của mình được biết nhé!

http://hochiminh.usconsulate.gov/ugrad-2015.html

USAID Partnership Opportunities in Innovation, Disability, and Governance
Date: Tuesday, January 27th, 2015
Time: 9:30 - 10:30 a.m.

Come hear about opportunities for organizations to work with the United States Agency for International Development in Vietnam (USAID/Vietnam). The event will include a briefing on USAID priorities in Vietnam from the Deputy Assistant Administrator for Asia and a short briefing on current partnership and funding opportunities. There will also be a question and answer session. The event will be in English with partial Vietnamese translation. 

To Attend:
Please register by 12:00 on January 26th to attend the event by signing up at this link https://docs.google.com/forms/d/1zYlRgqoxzNq4XtTvv0egLvqSd80mha2eiR7NB62y4lo/viewform. Please bring a photo identification to access the building. Questions about this event may be directed to Ms. Hanh Nguyen at tel: 04-3935 2181, mobile: 0962017875 or email: hanhnguyen@usaid.gov

Chúc mừng các bạn đã được chọn làm tình nguyện viên tại Triển lãm du học Hoa Kỳ vào thứ Năm tuần sau, 29/1/2015 tại Tổng Lãnh sự quán Hoa Kỳ. Hy vọng buổi tập huấn hôm qua đã mang đến cho các bạn nhiều thông tin bổ ích.  Chúc các bạn hoàn thành thật tốt công việc của mình!

Calling ALL #ExchangeAlumni and exchange participants! The Alumni Engagement Innovation Fund (#AEIF2015) launches on February 3! Your AEIF team can win up to $25,000 to implement a project! Learn more here: http://goo.gl/NhfRie

Cám ơn các bạn đã tham gia buổi giao lưu trực tuyến! Chúng tôi hy vọng các bạn cảm thấy buổi giao lưu hữu ích. Để có thêm thông tin về các cơ hội học tập ở Hoa Kỳ, hãy đến gặp gỡ chúng tôi tại triển lãm du học Hoa Kỳ vào ngày 29/1! Triển lãm sẽ được tổ chức tại Lãnh Sự Quán Hoa Kỳ ở số 7 Mạc Đỉnh Chi. Các bạn có thể nói chuyện trực tiếp với đại diện từ 45 trường đại học, cao đẳng được kiểm định đến từ Hoa Kỳ, các Viên chức Lãnh sự và Chuyên viên tư vấn. Triển lãm sẽ giới thiệu nhiều lựa chọn đa dạng của các loại hình giáo dục tại Hoa Kỳ từ các trường đại học công lập và tư thục đến các trường đào tạo hệ 4 năm và các trường cao đẳng cộng đồng. Triển lãm du học EducationUSA mở cửa miễn phí cho khách tham quan. Tuy nhiên, số lượng khách tham dự giới hạn. Xin vui lòng đăng ký trước theo giờ qua địa chỉ: http://hcmcedusafair2015-usconsulate.eventbrite.com. Hẹn gặp các bạn tại triển lãm!

Thank you for joining the webchat! We hope you found it helpful. For further information about educational opportunities in the U.S., come talk to us at our EducationUSA Fair on January 29th! The fair will be held at the U.S. Consulate General at 7 Mac Dinh Chi in District 1. You will be able to talk directly with representatives from 45 accredited U.S. universities and colleges, Consular Officers and Advisors. The fair will highlight the diverse range of education options available in the United States, from public and private universities, to four-year schools and community colleges. The EducationUSA fair is free and open to the public. However, space is limited. Pre-registration by hour is required and can be made via eventbrite: http://hcmcedusafair2015-usconsulate.eventbrite.com. We look forward to seeing you there!

Welcome to today’s webchat. We will cover a wide variety of topics, all related to studying in the United States. Do you have your questions ready? 
We will talk about topics like: U.S. Higher Education System, Different types of schools, Accreditation, Admissions, Scholarships/Financial Aid, Standardized Tests, Student Visas, Find-a-School Search Engine, Student Life, Available resources/services at the American Centers in Ho Chi Minh City and Hanoi. Many of you may also have questions about visas. 

Today we can only answer questions about visas and study in the U.S. If you have other questions, please wait for our upcoming consular webchat, which will cover many other types of questions about visas. OK, let’s start!
story: U.S. Consulate General - Ho Chi Minh City is with Jin Lam.

message:
Happening now President Obama is delivering his sixth State of the Union Address! Watch it live at WhiteHouse.gov/SOTU to follow along with exclusive interactive graphics and charts showing what the announcements mean for you. 
Then, be sure to stick around after the speech for an exclusive live video Q&A.

Buổi hỏi đáp trực tuyến về du học Hoa Kỳ sẽ diễn ra vào ngày mai Thứ Tư, ngày 21 tháng 1 lúc 11 giờ trưa. Bạn có thể hỏi bất cứ thông tin nào liên quan đến việc du học Hoa Kỳ ngay trong khung bình luận! Câu hỏi có thể bằng tiếng Anh hoặc bằng tiếng Việt. Xin đừng nêu thông tin cá nhân của bạn trong câu hỏi. Hẹn gặp các bạn ngày mai.

Our webchat on studying in the USA is coming up tomorrow Wednesday, Jan 21 at 11 am. Find out everything you need to know and more! Questions can be submitted in English or Vietnamese, but please don't include personal information. See you then.

The U.S. Consulate Ho Chi Minh City is closed today, Monday, January 19th, in observance of Martin Luther King, Jr. Holiday. 

Dr. Martin Luther King, Jr. once said, "Make a career of humanity...and you will make a greater person of yourself, a greater nation of your country, and a finer world to live in." Remembering these words, let's all take actions towards creating a better world for all on the MLK Day of Service. http://go.usa.gov/uaTx

message:
Sau gần 1 tháng tạm ngưng để sửa chữa, AC đã trở lại và mang đến cho các bạn một chương trình rất hay hốm nay, ngày 20/1/2015, lúc 2g chiều.

Tiến sỹ Geraldine L. Richmond - Đặc sứ Khoa học Hoa Kỳ sẽ đến thăm và có buổi nói chuyện tại Trung tâm Hoa Kỳ vào thứ ba, 20/1/2015 lúc 2 p.m. Bà sẽ trình bày về chủ đề làm cách nào để giao tiếp hiệu quả trong môi trường làm việc, và trong môi trường học thuật.  Chương trình mở rộng cho tất cả mọi người có quan tâm, không cần đăng ký trước.  Vui lòng đến sớm để tránh phải chờ đợi lâu!  Hẹn gặp mọi người tại AC.

Thinking about studying in the US? We will be hosting a webchat on January 21 on the American Center Facebook page. Ask us about selecting a school, applying for scholarships, improving your written English, how to apply for student visas, and more! 

Bạn đang nghĩ đến việc du học Mỹ và có nhiều câu hỏi không biết tỏ cùng ai? Hãy tham gia buổi nói chuyện trực tuyến của chúng tôi ngày 21/01 trên trang Facebook của Trung tâm Hoa Kỳ. Bạn có thể hỏi về việc chọn trường, nộp đơn xin học bổng, nâng cao kỹ năng viết tiếng Anh, nộp đơn xin visa du học, và còn nhiều nhiều các lĩnh vực khác nữa!

Join the 16,000 Vietnamese students already studying in the United States! Your first step is the EducationUSA Fair on January 29th at the U.S. Consulate in Ho Chi Minh City. The fair will be held at 7 Mac Dinh Chi, District 1 starting at 2pm. 

The event is free and open to the public. However, space is limited. Register now before spaces are all gone! Pre-registration by hour is required and can be made via eventbrite: http://hcmcedusafair2015-usconsulate.eventbrite.com 

See you there!

People have always been fascinated with the moon, stars and planets. “Space exploration captures the imagination and helps us understand who we are, where we came from and where we’re going,” said NASA’s Joshua Buck. “With an expression like ‘Houston, we have a problem,’ we’re tapping into our collective memory to communicate quickly and easily.”

These idioms all draw on space and space travel.
https://share.america.gov/talk-like-american-with-these-space-idioms/

Calling all Volunteers! Do you want a chance to practice your English? Do you want to meet American university representatives? Do you want to support educational opportunities for Vietnamese students? EducationUSA at the U.S. Consulate is seeking volunteers to help with the University Fair in Spring 2015!

Date: Thursday, January 29.
Time: 13:00 – 18:00
Location: U.S. Consulate General – 4 Le Duan District 1, Ho Chi Minh City.

Requirements:
- Current high school and university students in Ho Chi Minh city
- Good command of spoken English
- Responsible, sociable and active 
- Experience in interpreting and/or a good understanding of U.S. higher education is preferred.

Responsibilities:
- Assist with marketing for the event
- Work as interpreters for higher education representatives
- Assist at check-in desk
Volunteers will be trained and receive a stipend of 400,000 VND.

Apply:
Send your cover letter and CV to HCMCEDUSA@state.gov by January 9, 2015. 
Only short-listed applicants will be contacted for interviews.

MOOC Camp HCMC is coming back with "Grow to Greatness: Smart Growth for Private Businesses, Part 2" starting on January 12. While you complete the course requirements on your own time, Mr. Ted Nuyen, mentor from HCMC SME Networking and Mentoring will facilitate weekly discussions at the American Center to help you understand and apply materials, as well as get the most out of this course. We will have the Vietnamese translation for all videos of the course.

By passing the online course final exam and attending all of the discussions, you will receive a certificate of participation from the U.S. Consulate Ho Chi Minh City. Remember to register for both the course and discussion sessions.
Register for the course at https://www.coursera.org/course/GTG
Register for group discussion sessions at: http://goo.gl/5o9Yaq

Schedule:
Week 1: Thursday, January 15, 5:30 p.m.: The Entrepreneur Must Grow, Too! 
Week 2: Thursday, January 22, 5:30 p.m.: The “Secret” of High Performance is High Employee Engagement
Week 3: Thursday, January 29, 5:30 p.m.: Growth Is Much More Than a Strategy—It Requires a SYSTEM
Week 4: Thursday, February 5, 5:30 p.m.: The Surprising Difficulties in Building a Senior Management Team

March 5, 5:30 p.m.: Closing Ceremony

From December 15, 2014, the American Center will be closed for renovation. During this time, patrons who return books, still can contact the guards at the entrance. Normal hours will tentatively be resumed in early March. Please follow us on Facebook for updated information.

During AC renovation time, EducationUSA will provide one-on-one advising services during the following hours: Monday, Wednesday: 2 pm – 4 pm, Friday: 9 am – 11 am. To make an appointment, please call (08) 3520.4685 or (08) 3520.4625 during the mornings of Monday and Wednesday, Friday afternoons, and all day Tuesday and Thursday (office hours). In addition, you can also email your questions directly to hcmcedusa@state.gov. EducationUSA will temporarily halt phone advising during the above time period.

We are excited to announce that Willamette MBA has a new scholarship program available for international students:

The Willamette MBA Global Diversity Scholarship program is for international students who completed their bachelor degree in any of the following countries**: Armenia, Azerbaijan, Bahrain, Brazil, Bulgaria, Chile, China, Colombia, Egypt, Hong Kong, India, Indonesia, Iraq, Israel, Jordan, Kazakhstan, Kuwait, Lebanon, Philippines, Qatar, Romania, Taiwan, Thailand, Turkey, United Arab Emirates, and VIETNAM.

Applicants selected for this scholarship will receive a $5,000 Global Diversity scholarship and an Atkinson School Scholarship of at least $16,000. Thus, the total scholarship award for an applicant who receives a Global Diversity Scholarship and an Atkinson School Scholarship will range from $21,000 (57% of tuition) to approximately $37,000 (100% of tuition).

For more information about the requirements for this scholarship visit: http://www.willamette.edu/mba/full-time/financial_aid/scholarships/index.html

**Even applicants who do not qualify for a Global Diversity Scholarship will still receive full consideration for merit-based scholarships, based on eligibility. We encourage applicants from all over the world to apply!

Willamette MBA was recently ranked as a top MBA program in the U.S. by Businessweek and is specifically designed for students who are early in their career (no work experience required) or for those seeking a significant career change.

Climate change negotiators from all over the world are gathering for the UN Framework Convention on Climate Change (UNFCCC) Conference of the Parties (COP-20) in Lima, Peru. The United States is committed to combating global climate change and is working with international partners to forge an international agreement to reduce greenhouse gas emissions, accelerate clean energy innovations, and help the most vulnerable cope with the effects of climate change. #ActOnClimate
Learn more at http://www.state.gov/e/oes/climate/cop20/index.htm

Session 2: Tribes of the Midwest
Time: Friday, November 21, 3:00 p.m.

The Sioux are an iconic group, living in the central states of the US. Their story and history is long, sometimes joyful, sometimes tragic. Other tribes in regions have also preserved their languages, ways of life, and unique cultures. Come find out more about their stories at this talk.

Just one more day before the EducationUSA fair opens in District 1! Organized in cooperation with the Southeast Asian Minister of Education Organization (SEAMEO) Regional Training Center, the education fair will feature 24 American universities and institutions of higher learning who are visiting Vietnam. Take this chance to speak directly with representatives of schools from across the United States! The fair will take place from 2:00 - 5:30 pm (November 19th, tomorrow!) at 35 Le Thanh Ton (SEAMEO RETRAC) in central Ho Chi Minh City. See you there!

EducationUSA is organizing a fair in Ho Chi Minh City on November 19th from 2:00 - 5:30 pm at 35 Le Thanh Ton (SEAMEO RETRAC) in District 1. The event will feature 24 American universities and institutions of higher learning who are visiting Vietnam. We'll also have a session on American student visas. The event is free and open to the public. 

2:00 - 2:30 p.m. | Pre-fair Session: "U.S. Student Visa Process"
2:30 - 2:40 p.m. | Opening Remarks, Consul General Rena Bitter of the U.S. Consulate General in Ho Chi Minh City
2:40 - 5:30 p.m. | Fair time
4:00 - 5:30 p.m. | Breakout sessions
5:30 p.m. | Fair ends

See you there!

message:
Happening now: President Obama is meeting with members of the Young Southeast Asian Leaders Initiative (YSEALI) in Yangon, Myanmar. The event is live-streamed at http://www.whitehouse.gov/. Ms. Huong Vu and Long Nguyen are two YSEALI members from Vietnam attending this event in conjunction with YSEALI Generation Workshop: Power of Collaboration (Nov 11-14).  If you were in the audience what would you ask?  #YSEALI
 
Sự kiện đang diễn ra: Tổng thống Obama đang gặp gỡ các thành viên của Sáng kiến Thủ lĩnh trẻ Đông Nam Á (YSEALI) tại Yangon, Myanmar. Sự kiện được truyền trực tiếp tại địa chỉ:  http://www.whitehouse.gov/. Huong Vu và Long Nguyen là hai thành viên YSEALI Việt Nam đang tham dự sự kiện này cùng Hội thảo YSEALI: Sức mạnh của sự hợp tác (11-14/11). Bạn sẽ hỏi gì nếu được là khán giả của chương trình này? #YSEALI

message: Hôm nay AC đã hoạt động lại bình thường. Chương trình chiều nay "Disability Employment Awareness Month in the United States" diễn ra lúc 2 p.m. là chương trình cuối cùng của cô Jessica Chesbro tại AC. Mời các bạn đến tham dự và chia tay với cô nhé.

Maybe American-English speakers think with their stomachs, because they often express themselves in the language of cooking. Good friends who like the same things are “like two peas in a pod.” Any bad situation that gets worse moves “out of the frying pan and into the fire.” Something really easy is “a piece of cake.”
Check out more phrases at https://share.america.gov/food-talk-big-americas-melting-pot/

The American Center will be closed tomorrow, Tuesday, November 11 in observance of the American Veterans Day holiday.  Normal hours will be resumed on Wednesday.

November 11 is Veterans Day in the United States, and parades, ceremonies and tributes to veterans are planned in small towns and large cities throughout the country to honor those who have served in the U.S. military.

Read more: http://iipdigital.usembassy.gov/st/english/article/2007/11/20071109124825emohkcabhplar0.2962.html#ixzz3IftbKkdH

American Spaces provide welcoming and library-like environments in more than 800 locations across 169 countries. Visitors to American Spaces - 16 million and counting - can learn about U.S. policies, culture and values, practice their English and get information about studying in the U.S. American Spaces exemplify a core tenet of democracy: everyone’s right to free access to information. https://share.america.gov/books-over-burgers-importance-libraries-2/

Midterm Elections in the United States
Time: Wednesday, November 5, 2:00 p.m.
Speaker: Robert Crotty, Consulate Officer
Midterm elections, so-called because they occur in even-numbered years at the halfway point of a presidential term, determine which political party will control the two chambers of the U.S. Congress for the upcoming two years. Join Mr. Robert Crotty for an informative program to learn more about U.S. Elections Procedures.

Time: Friday, November 7, 2:00 p.m.
Speaker: Garrett, Harkin, Consulate Officer
Garrett Harkins will speak on the American non- profit sector; both the general environment and the different types of organizations. He will then give an overview of the process of registering an NGO in the United States and how it differs from the experience of starting a for profit company.

Good evening American Center fans! The American Center is pleased to announce its first English Discussion Club. The club is open to members who love to practice English and improve speaking skills. Each month, consulate officers or guest speakers will lead a discussion on a specific topic related to American culture or global issues. This month, the discussion topic is Global Food Security. It is scheduled in 3 sessions and led by a guest speaker Sarah Piccini. Mark your calendar and come join us. Registration is not required for this club. More information here: http://hochiminh.usconsulate.gov/ac/events.html

DOUBLE GOOD NEWS for those who want to go to grad schools in the U.S:

1. TEXAS CHRISTIAN UNIVERSITY SCHOLARSHIPS

Texas Christian University's MBA Program is announcing November 1, 2014 as the first deadline for priority scholarship and admission consideration. All applications meeting this first deadline will be considered for scholarships, which range from $28,987 to full scholarship with stipend at $56,400 per year.
For more information, please visit: http://bit.ly/QXJjlo

2. HOW ADULT & PROFESSIONAL EDUCATION PROGRAMS WORK IN THE U.S.

Director of International Recruitment of University of Redlands, Brian Jauregui will present a talk on "How adult and professional education programs work in the U.S." at the American Center, Diamond Plaza, the coming Tuesday, Oct 28 at 2pm. Please RSVP here: http://www.eventbrite.com/e/how-adult-and-professional-education-programs-work-in-the-us-tickets-13844010809?aff=eorg

Hey movie fans! It’s Audience Choice month at the American Classics Film Series tomorrow, Thursday, October 23. Vote now on your favorite genre and come at 4:30 tomorrow to watch a classic American film from the genre that gets the most votes. All votes due by noon tomorrow.
1. Romance
2. Comedy
3. Musical Theater
4. Drama
5. Horror/Suspense

Be a professional fellow in the United States! The YSEALI Professional Fellows Program is an exchange program for the best and brightest community leaders from ASEAN countries. Successful participants get a month-long fellowship at U.S.-based non-profit or other organizations, government offices or legislative bodies. Find out more today! (The application deadline is December 1.)

http://exchanges.state.gov/non-us/program/yseali-professional-fellows-program

"Undergraduates from abroad at nearly 345 U.S. colleges received aid packages during the most recent academic year for which data is available. The average scholarship awarded to an international student was $17,721." Find out how you can come study in the United States. http://goo.gl/FSfn5H

message: Today, October 16th, is World Food Day – a day of action to eradicate hunger in our lifetime. According to the Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations (FAO) one in nine people worldwide live with chronic hunger, and almost 5 million children under the age of 5 die of malnutrition-related causes every year. What are some ways to help reduce hunger and malnutrition around the world? Learn more at http://www.fao.org/world-food-day/en/

Fellowships in the United States. Check it out!  Deadline for submission: October 27th.

The Community Solutions Program is accepting applications for fellowships in the United States! If you are aged 25-38 and are currently working in a community engagement initiative, this program will help you gain experience alongside a U.S. community-based non-profit or other organization, government office or legislative body. Specific areas of focus are: Environmental Issues, Tolerance and Conflict Resolution, Transparency and Accountability, and Women and Gender Issues.  The deadline is Oct 27. Please see the website for the application and further details! http://exchanges.state.gov/non-us/program/community-solutions

Thanks all for attending a group discussion on Gender Equality yesterday to celebrate the International #DayofGirl  As informed, join us tonight for a Google+ Hangout at 6:30 p.m for further discussion. See you all online tonight! Click here to join: http://goo.gl/y7m3xq

International Day of the Girl Google + Hangout
Thursday, October 9 at 7:30 AM EST (6:30 PM Vietnam Time).  

Join the U.S. Department of State on October 9 at 6:30 p.m. Vietnam Time for a Google+ Hangout with U.S. Ambassador for Global Women’s Issues Cathy Russell and girls from around the world to discuss challenges and opportunities to empower adolescent girls to achieve their full potential. Join this very important conversation by posting your thoughts, questions, and ideas on Google+ or Twitter using #DayOfGirl and watch the hangout live.

message: AC tưng bừng mừng sinh nhật lần thứ ba, ai cũng được quà. Cám ơn các bạn đã luôn nhiệt tình ủng hộ AC trong suốt 3 năm vừa qua. Chiều nay AC sẽ có nhiều hoạt động vui nhộn, hấp dẫn. Phần quà tặng sẽ bao gồm sách, tài liệu, DVD học tiếng Anh, và quà lưu niệm. Các bạn cũng sẽ có cơ hội sưu tầm bộ huy hiệu được thiết kế dành riêng cho dịp kỷ niệm 3 năm thành lập AC. Chương trình kéo dài đến 6g30 kết thúc với buổi chiếu phim và thảo luận với ông Chris Helmkamp. Chào đón tất cả các bạn!

Kỷ niệm 3 năm thành lập, AC có một chương trình vui nhộn, bổ ích với nhiều phần quà bất ngờ, hấp dẫn dành cho các bạn hôm nay, thứ năm, 25/9, từ 8:30 sáng đến 6:30 chiều. Đừng bỏ qua nhé!  Hẹn gặp các bạn tại AC!

Phần thảo luận đặc biệt với các chủ đề học bổng du học Hoa Kỳ, thị thực sinh viên, giới thiệu các sản phẩm và dịch vụ tại Trung tâm Hoa Kỳ.  Đừng bỏ lỡ cơ hội nhận được những phần quà có giá trị từ chương trình! Xem thông tin chi tiết tại đây: http://backtoschoolopenday.eventbrite.com

Today is International Day of Peace. This is a day devoted to strengthening the ideals of peace, both within and among all nations and peoples.This year's theme is "Right of Peoples to Peace." http://www.un.org/en/events/peaceday/

UNIVERSITY OF MASSACHUSETTS AMHERST (MA) ACADEMIC SCHOLARSHIPS
UMass Amherst is proud to consider qualified international students for academic-based merit scholarships of up to $12,000 USD per academic year. No separate application is required, as students are automatically considered once admitted to the university. The merit scholarships were established to recognize the high level of academic achievement of students coming to our university from around the world. Available to undergraduate students only, these scholarships are based upon a student’s high school GPA and standardized test score, such as SAT or ACT.
For more information, please visit: http://bit.ly/WyCsUZ
#Scholarship #Undergrad

UNIVERSITY OF THE PEOPLE HP WOMENS SCHOLARSHIP FUND
The HP Women’s Scholarship Fund offers two-year scholarships to female students at University of the People (UoPeople), enabling them to pursue an associate degree in a program of their choice. 

Students who are awarded a scholarship also have access to mentoring support from HP employees. These HP mentors provide UoPeople students with invaluable guidance and support, enriching their academic learning experience and playing a pivotal role in preparing them for employment after graduation. The mentors are an integral part of the support students receive in this program.
For more information, please visit: http://bit.ly/1riq5YX
#Scholarship #Undergrad

message:
The time has come for our final, grand prize AC Road Trip clue! Our journey has come to an end in the capital of the United States, Washington, DC! 

It's been so fun driving across  the U.S. "with" all of our friends from Vietnam. Special congratulations to our 12 clue winners, pictured on our map. 

For the final, grand prize, can you answer these questions:
1. What U.S. road trip destination did we miss that you would most like to visit?
2. How far do you think we drove on this trip? Make sure to specify if your guess is in miles or kilometers!

Good luck 🚗🚕🚙🇺🇸

Wow! You guys gave great advice for American students who might be interested in studying in Vietnam. We think there should be multiple winners, but we have to pick just one: congratulations Ngn Anh Thu!
Everybody stay tuned for our final destination and grand prize question.

NORTHERN STATE UNIVERSITY (SD) ADVANCED ESL SCHOLARSHIPS
A limited number of $1,500 first-year scholarships are available to international students who place in the advanced ESL program at Northern State University. To qualify, you must achieve at least an IELTS 5.0 or TOEFL 51 score. If you do not have a test score, you can take a placement test on campus.

This first-year scholarship will be applied to your tuition bill over the first two semesters of your degree program. Applications are now being accepted for the spring 2015 (January) intake.
For more information, please visit: http://bit.ly/1bDLS4r
#Scholarship #Undergrad

Summer is ending, and so must our Road Trip! This is our last mini-clue before the grand prize.  

We stopped in Williamsburg, Virginia, home of the beautiful College of William & Mary.  At most U.S. universities, the Center for International Studies helps to support international students studying in the United States, as well as American students who want to study abroad.

SO, the question for you is: What advice would you give to an American student interested in a study exchange to Vietnam?

Comment below to win prize #12! 🚘🚗🚕

message: Hello September!  Stay tuned for several exciting programs at the American Center to celebrate a new school year!

Nhiều bạn phản hồi mong muốn cùng tham dự cả hai chương trình cùng lúc chiều nay nên AC dời buổi A Day Without Space sang sáng mai, thứ 6, 5/9, lúc 10:00am nhé các bạn. Buổi hướng dẫn điền đơn Common Application giữ nguyên 2:00 chiều nay. Không cần đăng ký trước, chỉ mang theo CMND hoặc thẻ học sinh/sinh viên để vào cổng. Hẹn gặp các bạn sớm!

Also at 2:00pm tomorrow, Thursday, Sept. 4 at the AC: a workshop for students applying to American universities and colleges. Ms. Mary de Villiers from University of Notre Dame, will help you to take a head start for your college application process by going through the new online Common Application (CA4) section by section. 

For those who haven't heard about the Common Application: it is an undergraduate college admission application that applicants may use to apply to more than 500 colleges and universities in the US.

Một chương trình thú vị vào ngày mai đây các bạn ơi.

A Day Without Space
Time: Thursday, September 4, 2:00 p.m. - 4:00 p.m.
Speaker: Elma Hajric, U.S. Consulate Summer Intern 

Expanding your galaxy... come and join us for a view 2,000 km above the Earth. You will learn more about the importance of space in our daily lives as well as the outer space activities of the region in general and how Vietnam plays a significant part in these activities.

Photo credit: NASA

For those who haven't heard about the Common Application: it is an undergraduate college admission application that applicants may use to apply to more than 500 colleges and universities in the US.
