Volunteerism: Virtual Q&A discussion with Omowale Ogunrinde and Korvi Rakshand

Thursday, September 12, 7:00PM Vietnam Time
Click here to join: https://conx.state.gov/digital-diplomacy

Interested in volunteerism, local activism and finding out how you can get involved in local and international communities? Join us for a Q&A discussion on volunteerism featuring three esteemed speakers, and share your voice.

Omowale Ogunrinde, Executive Director of Foundation for Skills Development - Omowale Ogunrinde is the Founder and Executive Director of the Foundation for Skills Development, a seven-year old vocational and technical training center that each year serves 5,000 unemployed adults, youth, and physically challenged people. Foundation for Skills Development offers technical training in areas such as catering, fashion design, woodwork, electronics, computers and electrical repairs. Ogunrinde was a delegate at the Presidential Summit on Entrepreneurship in 2010. Ogunrinde earned an MBA (1990) and a PGDE (1998) from the University of Lagos.

Korvi Rakshand, Founder of JAAGO Foundation - After earning his law degree in 2007 at the age of 21, Korvi Rakshand decided to forgo the family business and open a school for children in poverty. Later that year, Rakshand and a group of friends founded JAAGO, starting with a class of 17 students in a small classroom. Today, the project has flourished to 1,200 students spread across three schools. Rakshand grew up in Dhaka, Bangladesh and continues to provide higher education to underprivileged children in the city.

Tom Godwin's story "The Cold Equations" rocked the science fiction world when it appeared. A pilot is on an emergency mission to a planet whose colony is doomed if he doesn't reach them. He has just enough fuel to get there - then he finds he has a stowaway, a young girl wanting to be with her brother on the colony

Labor Day, celebrated in the United States on the first Monday of each September, is the nation’s official commemoration of its workers’ contributions to national strength, prosperity and well-being. It also marks for millions of Americans the unofficial end of summer. This year, Labor Day falls on Monday, September 2nd. The American Center will be closed on Monday in observation of Labor Day.

Read more: http://goo.gl/qc5I01

message:
President Obama delivers remarks at the Let Freedom Ring ceremony on the steps of the Lincoln Memorial to commemorate the 50th Anniversary of the March on Washington.

Video: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=M-wEk1lmZMo

Read the Transcript: http://go.usa.gov/DaHz
Don't forget this exciting event tomorrow, Friday, August 30, 2:00 p.m.  See you all there!

There’s a reason why so many who marched that day, and in the days to come, were young -- for the young are unconstrained by habits of fear, unconstrained by the conventions of what is. They dared to dream differently, to imagine something better. And I am convinced that same imagination, the same hunger of purpose stirs in this generation. —President Obama on the 50th Anniversary of the March on Washington.

Today marks the 50th anniversary of Martin Luther King Jr. famous "I Have A Dream" speech. 

You can listen to the full speech here: http://bit.ly/15f9u0r This is a great resource for teachers teaching about the Civil Rights Movement in America.

In August 1963, the Reverend Martin Luther King Jr., one of the most iconic civil rights heroes in American history, gave his famous “I Have a Dream Speech” on the National Mall in Washington, DC.   Sean will talk about the significance of this speech in U.S. history, and how we continue to honor Dr. King today.

Today, August 12th, is International Youth Day!! This day was created by the UN, and has become a worldwide movement. How will you celebrate? This year's theme is ‘Youth Migration: Moving Development Forward.’ Find out more here: http://undesadspd.org/Youth/InternationalYouthDay/2013.aspx

message: A cell phone that facilitates search and rescue efforts for trapped earthquake victims; a machine that converts plastic waste into fuel; and capsule shells that utilize fish fins and scales instead of pig skins and bovine hides. These are a just a few of the 2013 GIST Tech-I entries by the Asian entrepreneurs competing in the GIST Tech-I Competition – and YOU can help them advance to the next round! Visit http://bit.ly/GISTTechIVote to watch all of the entries, and vote for your favorite business pitch.  Anyone can vote! Voting ends August 22.

Please mark your calendar for several exciting events at the American Center next week.  No registration is required for these programs.  See you all there!

The Real New York
Time: Tuesday, August 13, 2:00 p.m.
Speaker: Anna Dupont, Consulate Officer

When you think about New York, what comes to mind? Manhattan, the Empire State building, Times Square, “the Big Apple”?  There’s a lot more to New York State than that! Come join Anna as she continues the summer’s “Discover America” with a trip a little further up the Hudson River, to discover the REAL New York.

2013 Spelling Bee – Round 2

Venue: The American Center, 8th Floor, Diamond Plaza, 34 Le Duan Blvd., District 1, HCMC

Sci-fi Short Story Club
Time: Thursday, August 15, 5:00 p.m.
Speaker: Amy Lindsay, PAS American Intern

We will be reading Isaac Asimov’s short story, “The Last Question.” Proclaimed by Asimov himself to be his “favorite story” of all those he has written, it is a fascinating read that delves into topics such as entropy and the role of computers in our society. Please make sure you read the story before joining the club.  No registration is required. 

Here’s the link: http://filer.case.edu/dts8/thelastq.htm

Mời các bạn đến tham gia cổ vũ cho 50 thí sinh ở vòng đấu kế tiếp của cuộc thi đánh vần 2013.  Vòng thi 1 này hứa hẹn rất kịch tính và hấp dẫn. Hẹn gặp mọi người chiều mai, thứ ba, 6/8 lúc 2g chiều nhé!

Mời các bạn đọc bài "Tâm sự của ông Tổng Lãnh sự Lê Thành Ân  khi rời thành phố Hồ Chí Minh kết thúc nhiệm kỳ". Ông Tổng Lãnh sự sẽ chính thức rời Việt Nam vào ngày 6/8/2013. AC xin gửi nhiều lời chúc tốt đẹp đến ông và gia đình! 

Tổng lãnh sự Hoa Kỳ Lê Thành Ân: "Tôi muốn nhân cơ hội này nói lời cuối cùng rằng 'kỷ niệm luôn là hành trang quý giá nhất' đã giúp tôi đạt được thành công tại đây và nói thêm với Việt Nam rằng 'Chia tay là để gặp lại' bởi nơi đây tôi cảm thấy thực sự được đón chào."

What do eco-friendly insecticidal fertilizer, energy efficient stoves, and a health-monitoring computer mouse have in common? All three of these science and tech innovations have become quarter-finalists in the 2013 GIST Tech-I Competition! 90 entrepreneurs have made it this far, but only 30 will make it into the next round! Choose the best Tech-I entry at http://bit.ly/GISTTechIVote by August 22 and help your favorite entrepreneur compete at the Global Entrepreneurship Summit.

message: Mời các bạn đã đăng ký tham gia cuộc thi đánh vần "2013 Spelling Bee" đến tham dự vòng sơ tuyển vào chiều mai, thứ tư, lúc 2g.  Các bạn nhớ đến đúng giờ nhé!  Cuộc thi hứa hẹn nhiều bất ngờ và kịch tính.  Hẹn gặp mọi người!

Global Tiger Day is today, July 29! Habitat loss, wildlife trafficking, and poaching are threatening to push this magnificent creature into extinction in the wild. The United States works with tiger range countries and international forums like the Convention on International Trade in Endangered Species of Wild Fauna and Flora to protect the species.

Can you name the thirteen countries where tigers are found? http://goo.gl/AU4TM9

Thông báo: AC đã nhận đủ số lượng đăng ký tham dự cuộc thi đánh vần Spelling Bee. Đường link đăng ký sẽ không còn vào được nữa. Chiều nay, AC sẽ gửi email xác nhận cho các bạn.  Hẹn gặp các bạn vào chiều thứ tứ, đúng 2g.  Các bạn nhớ đi sớm chút, vì đi trễ sau khi cuộc thi đã bắt đầu thì không vào được nữa.  Cám ơn các bạn đã đăng ký tham gia và chúc mọi người may mắn!

message:
President Obama Meets with President Truong Tan Sang of Vietnam

President Obama met with President Truong Tan Sang of Vietnam today, the first bilateral meeting between the two leaders and an opportunity to further strengthen the relationship between our countries. Please share the picture and links with your friends!

Tổng thống Obama tiếp đón Chủ tịch Trương Tấn Sang

Hôm nay, Tổng thống Obama gặp Chủ tịch nước Việt Nam Trương Tấn Sang. Đây là cuộc gặp gỡ song phương đầu tiên giữa hai nhà lãnh đạo, là cơ hội để tăng cường quan hệ giữa hai nước. Hãy chia sẻ ảnh và liên kết với mọi người nhé các bạn!

Tiếng Anh tại http://vietnam.usembassy.gov/ và tiếng Việt tại http://vietnamese.vietnam.usembassy.gov

Here is a not-to-be-missed event from EducationUSA.  See you all there!

THE IVY LEAGUE SCHOOLS IN THE U.S. - WHAT DOES THAT MEAN? 

This group of prestigious colleges and universities represents the "American Dream" in the minds of thousands of students aiming to study in the U.S. Let’s take a closer look at "the Ivies" with Mr. Spencer Wolff, a Harvard, Columbia and Yale alumnus. He will share his first-hand experience and discuss the wide range of opportunities associated with these elite names, as well as the myths and realities of what the Ivy League means in higher education today.

When: Tuesday July 16th, 14:00 -15:30
Where: EducationUSA Advising Center – 8th Floor Diamond Plaza
To register: email HCMCEDUSA@state.gov, click “like” on Facebook.com/EducationUSA.hochiminhcity, or just show up.

United Nations Secretary General Ban Ki-mmon commenmorated July 12 as Malala Day.  Malala Yousafzai is the Pakistani girl who was shot in the face by the Taliban last year. She celebrated her 16th birthday by giving an incredible speech at the U.N.  Watch her inspiring speech here: http://goo.gl/NMhC2

Phát Biểu của Thư Ký Báo Chí Nhà Trắng Về Chuyến Thăm của Chủ Tịch Nước Việt Nam Trương Tấn Sang

11/7/2013

Vào Thứ Năm, ngày 25 tháng 7, Tổng Thống Obama sẽ tiếp Chủ Tịch Nước Cộng Hòa Xã Hội CHủ Nghĩa Việt Nam Trương Tấn Sang tại Nhà Trắng. Tổng Thống sẽ nhân dịp này thảo luận với Chủ Tịch Sang làm thế nào để củng cố hơn nữa quan hệ đối tác giữa hai nước trong các vấn đề chiến lược của khu vực và tăng cường hợp tác với ASEAN. Tổng Thống cũng trông đợi thảo luận vấn đề nhân quyền, các thách thức đang phát sinh như biến đổi khí hậu, và tầm quan trọng của việc hoàn tất Hiệp Định Đối Tác Xuyên Thái Bình Dương (TPP).

Photo: Tổng thống Hoa Kỳ Barack Obama và Phu nhân đón Chủ tịch nước Trương Tấn Sang và Phu nhân ngày 12/11/2011. Source:truongtansang.net

The King of the Cold War: or what did Elvis Presley have to do with U.S. Foreign Policy?
Time: Monday, July 8, 2:00 p.m.
Venue: The American Center, 8th Floor, Diamond Plaza, 34 Le Duan Blvd., District 1, HCMC
Speaker: Professor Michael G. Vann, Sacramento State University

Around the world, Elvis Presley is without doubt one of the most iconic images from American popular culture in the era of the Cold War. He is generally associated with domestic developments from the 1950s to the 1970s such as youth culture, sexuality, and African-American influences on white commercial music. But, U.S. scholar Michael Vann has another theory about Elvis’ Hollywood movie roles, and what they might have to say about U.S. foreign policy. Come to the AC to hear Professor Vann’s lively talk about what American popular culture can tell us about American history!

July 4th is Independence Day in the USA. In 1776, one of U.S. Founding Fathers John Adams famously predicted that Independence Day would be celebrated "with pomp and parade, with shows, games, sports, guns, bells, bonfires, and illuminations, from this time forward forever more." How is Vietnam’s Independence Day celebrated? http://goo.gl/lHoVj

The tangible birthplace of the United States is Independence Hall in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania, where the U.S. Declaration of Independence was signed in 1776 and the Constitution of the United States was adopted in 1787. “Discover America: Summer Presentation Contest” - Frequently Asked Questions: 

1. Q: How many people are allowed on a team?
    A: Teams should be two to three people.

2. Q: How many states do I need to include in my tour?
    A: The tour must take place in the United States of America.  Beyond that, there is no minimum number of states to visit.

3. Q: For accommodation, can I arrange a homestay?
    A: Yes!  There are many organizations offering homestays in the US, and provided it is open to the general public, you can include it on your tour.

4. Q: Can I schedule my tour so I stay with relatives, eat meals there, or borrow their car?
    A: No. The contest is on your ability to put together a package tour. You cannot plan for your tourist to accept favors from your friends or relatives.

5. Q: Do I need to include tipping in my budget?
    A: Yes. Tipping in the US is typically 15-20%.  

6. Q: Does the 7 day tour include the time on the flight?
    A: No. The 7 day tour is counted from the moment you arrive in the U.S to the moment you leave the U.S.

7. Q: Does $4,500 include the visa fee?
    A: No. It doesn’t.

We’re highlighting pollinator conservation in honor of Pollinator Week (June 17-23)! Pollination is a critical ecosystem service provided by biodiversity, and crucial for global agriculture. What is your favorite type of pollinator?

A.	Bees
B.	Wasps

message:
Pacific Angel 2013 in Dong Hoi, Quang Binh, Vietnam

The United States and Vietnam conducts humanitarian assistance operations June 10-14 as part of Operation Pacific Angel.

Officially in its sixth year, Operation PACANGEL is a joint and combined humanitarian assistance exercise led by Pacific Air Forces. Operation PACANGEL 2013 includes medical, dental, optometry, and engineering programs as well as various subject-matter expert exchanges.

Approximately 56 U.S. military members, along with local non-governmental organizations and host nation military forces are conducting humanitarian assistance operations in Dong Hoi, Quang Binh Province, Vietnam as part of this operation.

PACANGEL enhances participants' humanitarian assistance and disaster relief capabilities.

'Kinky Boots' Wins Best Musical At 2013 Tony Awards

The feel-good musical "Kinky Boots," with songs by pop star Cyndi Lauper, won the 2013 Tony Award for best musical. 

The Antoinette Perry Award for Excellence in Theatre, more commonly known informally as the Tony Award, recognizes achievement in live Broadway theatre. The awards are presented by the American Theatre Wing and The Broadway League at an annual ceremony in New York City. Read more here: http://www.tonyawards.com/index.html

Photo: http://www.huffingtonpost.com/

A state-by-state guide to iconic US foods by Emily Matchar on Lonely Planet

One of the hands-down greatest things about eating in America is all the hyper-regional specialties. A food that’s ubiquitous in Georgia might draw blank stares in Massachusetts, while a Montana delicacy might horrify citizens of neighboring Washington. We say: why not try them all! We’ve selected one quintessential food from each state, so you can do just that. Remember, there are 50 states: pace yourself!

Did you know that the first Friday of June is also National Donut Day in the United States? 

But today is about more than the sweet treat! The National Donut Day was created by The Salvation Army in 1938 to honor the women who served doughnuts to soldiers during World War I, and is celebrated on the first Friday of June. The holiday celebrates the doughnut (a.k.a. "donut") – an edible, torus-shaped piece of dough which is deep-fried and sweetened. Many American doughnut stores offer free doughnuts on National Doughnut Day.
Happy World Oceans Day! The two-year theme for 2013 and 2014 is “together we have the power to protect the ocean!” How do you protect the ocean? http://goo.gl/Et23L (Photo: infocentral.state.gov)

Book Club Activities this afternoon, 5:00 p.m.

An Occurrence at Owl Creek Bridge by Ambrose Bierce

Short story by Ambrose Bierce, published in 1891 in Tales of Soldiers and Civilians. The narrative concerns the final thoughts of a Southern planter as he is being hanged by Union soldiers. In the brief period between the tightening of the noose and the actual breaking of his neck, the man imagines his escape. 

Don't miss a chance to discuss this story with Ms. Jaclyn Luo this afternoon at 5:00 p.m.  See you all there!

Attention teachers! Want to take your students on a field trip to J.N. “Ding” Darling National Wildlife Refuge (Official) without ever leaving the classroom? Discovery Education is presenting a virtual field trip live from Sanibel Island, FL. The refuge is part of the largest undeveloped mangrove ecosystem in the U.S., and is famous for its migratory bird populations. http://bit.ly/13Z27q6 (Photo: Harold Wagle)

Happy International Day for Biodiversity May 22! This year's theme is water and biodiversity, which reminds us that water is essential for life and that no living being on planet Earth can survive without it. Did you know that only a tiny amount of the total water on our planet (0.03%) is available as liquid freshwater at or near the land surface? 

For more information, visit: http://goo.gl/Lnla8

Happy Mother's Day to all the Moms out there! Mother’s Day in the United States is celebrated each year on the second Sunday in May. In millions of households, mothers will be honored with flowers, greeting cards, candy, a special cake and, perhaps, breakfast in bed or a special lunch or dinner at a restaurant. What do you plan to do to celebrate your mother today?

This holiday owes its start to Anna Jarvis, who held a memorial to her mother in 1899. Jarvis’s mother had founded work clubs for women in her home state of West Virginia to improve sanitary and health conditions. Jarvis campaigned to have “Mother’s Day” recognized as a national celebration.

President Woodrow Wilson made Mother's Day official in 1914. According to the U.S. Census Bureau, there are an estimated 85 million mothers in the United States and the average number of children they have is 2.5. Most American mothers — 55 percent — are employed outside the home, according to the Census Bureau.

Read more: http://iipdigital.usembassy.gov/st/english/inbrief/2012/05/201205115528.html#ixzz2T2fLqtAB

message: Happy Birthday, Minnesota! On May 11, 1858, Minnesota became the 32nd state in the United States. Minnesota is known as the "Land of 10,000 Lakes” but it actually has 12,000 lakes. message: Five presidents in one photo! After the dedication ceremony attended by five living Presidents on April 25th, the Bush Center, on the campus of Southern Methodist University, will open to the public on May 1, 2013. It is the 13th presidential library or museum run by the U.S. National Archives and Records Administration. The Center will house a vast amount of documents, records and artifacts from George W. Bush's presidency that lasted from 2001 to 2009. Tell us what you would like to see on a visit to the George W. Bush Presidential Center. http://goo.gl/5LtgY

Naval Activity 2013 with Vietnam: USS Chung Hoon arrives in Da Nang (April 21, 2013)

DA NANG, Vietnam (April 21, 2013) The guided-missile destroyer USS Chung Hoon (DDG 93) arrives in Da Nang, Vietnam for a Naval Engagement Activity (NEA). The NEA provides opportunities for U.S. and Vietnamese naval professionals to share best practices and exchange maritime skills. Maritime skill exchanges between the two navies are non-combatant events, such as humanitarian assistance and disaster relief, medical training, fire fighting and damage control, search and rescue, diving and salvage, sports and community service projects. (U.S. Navy photo by Mass Communication Specialist 1st Class Jay C. Pugh/Released)

The Federal Reserve Board on Wednesday announced that the redesigned $100 note will begin circulating on October 8, 2013.

This note, which incorporates new security features such as a blue, 3-D security ribbon, will be easier for the public to authenticate but more difficult for counterfeiters to replicate.

The new design for the $100 note was unveiled in 2010, but its introduction was postponed following an unexpected production delay.

Read more: http://www.newmoney.gov/stakeholder/journalist/release_04242013.htm

Every year Earth day is celebrated on April 22, but do you know when was the first Earth Day celebrated? Was it 

1. April 22, 1969
2. April 22, 1970
3. April 22, 1971
4. April 22, 1972

In the United States, Earth Day is not an official holiday, but it is still celebrated in many ways. Americans of all ages participate in events to increase public awareness of environmental concerns and to celebrate their respect for the environment.

Learn more about Earth Day in this month's content spotlight: http://1.usa.gov/17dj9lI

message:
The Light Between Oceans By M.L. Stedman

Tom Sherbourne takes a job as the lighthouse keeper on Janus Rock, nearly half a day’s journey from the coast. To this isolated island, Tom brings a young, bold, and loving wife, Isabel. Years later, after two miscarriages and one stillbirth, the grieving Isabel hears a baby’s cries on the wind. A boat has washed up onshore carrying a dead man and a living baby. Tom wants to report the man and infant immediately. But Isabel insists the baby is a “gift from God,” and against Tom’s judgment, they claim her as their own and name her Lucy. When she is two, Tom and Isabel return to the mainland and are reminded that there are other people in the world and how devastating their choice really is.

Meet Brittany and Jack: Science Student Superstars 
Wednesday, April 10, 2013, 7:00 p.m. Vietnam time
Live webchat URL: https://conx.state.gov/digital-diplomacy
 
Description:  Are you curious about using technology to better understand the world around you?  Learn how 17 year-old Brittany Wenger and 16 year-old Jack Andraka, both grand prize winners of separate international science competitions, invented cancer diagnosis and detection tools.  Join Brittany and Jack to discover why they decided to start experimenting, which challenges they needed to overcome, and what their plans are for next year.  Don’t miss this opportunity to tune in and ask questions – Brittany and Jack will answer them live!

World Health Day is celebrated on 7 April to mark the anniversary of the founding of WHO in 1948. Each year a theme is selected for World Health Day that highlights a priority area of public health concern in the world. The theme for 2013 is high blood pressure. You know the other name for high or raised blood pressure and what all it can lead to? http://www.who.int/campaigns/world-health-day/2013/en/index.html

April Fools' Day is celebrated in many countries on April 1 every year. April 1 is not a national holiday, but is widely recognized and celebrated as a day when people play practical jokes and hoaxes on each other. Here's from a curator of the greatest practical jokes in history that have been pulled on April Fool's Day. http://www.museumofhoaxes.com/hoax/aprilfool/

It's time for the "Dugong Fact of the Day".  Check out this fact and join American Center "Save the Dugong" Logo Design Contest http://goo.gl/Pxsg4.  Contest End Date: April 12. Nice weekend everyone!

Fact 4: Female Dugongs give birth underwater to a single calf every three to seven years. It can take a mother Dugong fifteen months of pregnancy to have a baby. Birth takes place in shallow water and the baby Dugong is able to swim to the top of the water for its first breath. Baby Dugongs are about 100 to 120cm long and weigh 20 to 30 kg. The calf stays with its mother, drinking milk from her teats and following close by until 18-24 months of age. Dugongs reach adult size between 9 and 17 years of age, and have a lifespan similar to humans,if left alone.

Source: Unique Australian Animal

Here is another interesting fact about Dugongs.  Read and Like our "Dugong Fact of the Day" series!

Fact 3: Dugongs can live as long as seventy years. Dugongs are closely related to manatees.  Dugongs have fluked tails, like whales.  Dugongs are said to be the basis for the legend of the mermaid. The average adult Dugong is about 2.7 meters long and weighs about 300 kilograms.

Fact 2: Dugongs are the only marine mammals that are strict herbivores, Dugongs have oddly-shaped mouths because they’re specially shaped to eat plants off the sea bottom When Dugongs eat, they eat every part of the plant.

Welcome to the Dugong Fact of the Day!

How much do you know about Dugongs? Everyday starting today, AC will post a new fact about Dugongs!  Like our page and enjoy daily updates about these magnificent animals!

Fact 1: Dugongs, like cows, are warm-blooded mammals. They are sometimes called “sea cows” because they live off sea grasses.  In Vietnamese, they are called "Bò Biển", "Lợn Biển", or "Nàng Tiên Cá"!

Mời các bạn đã đăng ký và nhận xác nhận ngày mai đến tham dự chương trình. Cáo lỗi các bạn nào chưa đăng ký được lần này. Lưu ý: bạn nào đăng ký mà không dự được vui lòng báo lại để nhường chỗ cho các bạn khác vì còn rất nhiều bạn muốn tham gia mà không có chỗ. Nếu các bạn không nghiêm túc, đăng ký mà bỏ không tham gia thì lần sau, AC buộc phải từ chối việc tham gia của các bạn. AC đã cố gắng hết sức để phục vụ các bạn nên mong các bạn hợp tác nhé. Chúc mọi người ngủ ngon!
https://www.facebook.com/events/469081536492853/

Thông báo: Chiều nay AC đã gửi mail xác nhận về buổi "Public Speaking" ngày thứ sáu, ngày 15/3 cho các bạn rồi đó.  Các bạn lưu ý form đăng ký của buổi Soft Skills tiếp theo sẽ được đăng vào thứ sáu 5/4 lúc 5 giờ chiều. Các bạn nhớ đón theo dõi và đăng ký nhé.  Chúc mọi người ngủ ngon!

Thông báo: Nếu các bạn nào đã đăng ký dự buổi bổ sung Resume Writing thì chiều nay cứ đến tham dự lúc 2g nhé.  Nếu chưa nhận được email cũng không sao, có đăng ký trước là có tên rồi.  Cám ơn các bạn.
AC đã gửi email xác nhận về buổi tập huấn bổ sung Resume Writing cho các bạn đăng ký hôm 1/3 rồi. Các bạn kiểm tra maill và nhớ đi đúng giờ nhé. Hẹn gặp mọi người.
Don't forget this exciting event tomorrow, Wednesday, March 13, at 5:00 p.m.  See you all there!

Webchat: Tales from the Wild: Wildlife Q&A with Animal Ambassador Julie Scardina. 
When: Tuesday, March 12, 2013, 9:00 a.m. Vietnam Time.  Click here to join: https://conx.state.gov/digital-diplomacy 

Learn about wildlife conversation with Julie Scardina, Animal Ambassador for SeaWorld, Busch Gardens, and Discovery Cove! Join Scardina and a representative from the World Wildlife Fund (WWF) to discuss issues of biodiversity and habitat protection, focusing on marine life and habitats. Scardina will also discuss the importance of multilateral agreements like the CITES treaty, as well as the role corporations and organizations can play in combating wildlife trafficking and promoting conservation.
Wow! Big group today!

On International Women’s Day, Secretary of State John Kerry and First Lady Michelle Obama honored 9 extraordinary women, including "Nirbhaya", with the Secretary of State’s International Women of Courage Award. Secretary Kerry lauds the courage of the recipients in this clip from his address. "One of our awardees is in hiding. One is in prison. Another is locked under house arrest. And we present a fourth award posthumously for a brave woman whose life was brazenly stolen by brutal violence." http://goo.gl/mV35O

Mời các bạn xem phần dịch đoạn liên quan tới Việt Nam trong bài phát biểu đầu tiên của Ngoại trưởng Kerry về chính sách đối ngoại của Hoa Kỳ vào ngày 20/2 vừa qua:

Một trong những thực tế đáng ngạc nhiên nhất của nước Mỹ xưa nay do là chúng ta không có kẻ thù nào dài lâu. Bây giờ, xin được bàn về Việt Nam. Tôi sẽ không bao giờ quên được giây phút đứng cạnh Thượng Nghị sĩ John McCain trong phòng phía Đông của Nhà Trắng. Chúng tôi mỗi người đứng một bên Tổng thống Clinton, khi ông tuyên bố bình thường hóa quan hệ với Việt Nam, điều mà có thời được cho là không tưởng, nhưng đó là kết quả của nổ lực mà Thượng Nghị sĩ John McCain và tôi đã thực hiện suốt mười năm.
 
Trong suốt thập niên vừa qua, nhờ phần lớn vào công lao của Cơ quan Viện trợ Phát triển Quốc tế Hoa Kỳ (USAID), xuất khẩu của chúng ta sang Việt Nam tăng trên 700 phần trăm. Mỗi một phần trăm trong đó thể hiện mức độ kiến tạo ra công ăn việc làm tại Hoa Kỳ. Và trong hai thập niên qua, hàng nghìn sinh viên và học giả Việt Nam đã theo học và giảng dạy tại Hoa Kỳ thông qua chương trình Fulbright, trong số họ có cả Bộ trưởng Ngoại giao (hiện nay) của Việt Nam, người mà tôi hôm trước vừa có trao đổi, và hãy tin tôi đi, bản thân ông ta cũng có những cảm tình đối với nước Mỹ, nhờ chính sự trải nghiệm đó.
Mời các bạn xem đoạn video clip về buổi nói chuyện của Ngoại trưởng Kerry hôm 20/2 nhé.

HAPPENING NOW: Renowned Abraham Lincoln scholar Harold Holzer will answer your questions on his latest book, Lincoln: How Abraham Lincoln Ended Slavery in America, the official young adult companion book to Steven Spielberg’s latest film. Mr. Holzer will discuss the importance of the Emancipation Proclamation and answer your online questions. Join us now at http://goo.gl/uJI1o

U.S. Secretary of State John F. Kerry made his first public address regarding U.S. foreign policy and diplomacy on February 20. The speech took place on the historic Grounds of the University of Virginia campus. The University has a unique place in American history as its founder, Thomas Jefferson, served as the country’s first Secretary of State. Read Sec. Kerry’s speech here: http://hochiminh.usconsulate.gov/secretary-02202013.html

Did you know that 1/3 of food produced goes to waste?  Meanwhile, more than one billion people, 1/6 of the world's population, suffer from chronic hunger. Learn about Feed the Future, Pres. Obama’s global hunger and food security initiative, and how reducing postharvest loss can help prevent starvation.

The American Center will be closed in observance of George Washington’s birthday on Monday, February 18, 2013. Normal hours will be resumed on Tuesday, February 19, 2013.  Hope everyone enjoyed long Tet holidays.. 

George Washington was the first president of the United States. The observance of George Washington's Birthday is the third Monday in February. Many Americans refer to the holiday as Presidents' Day as a way of honoring all past presidents.

Read more here: http://iipdigital.usembassy.gov/st/english/inbrief/2013/02/20130211142379.html#axzz2KqhA1EZh

Dear all friends, "Live well, Laugh often and Love much" in 2013! Enjoy your first day of the year of the Snake!

Sắp đến giao thừa rồi, AC chia sẻ với các bạn phát biểu chúc mừng xuân Quý Tỵ của Tổng thống Obama nè!  
Statement by the President on the Lunar New Year:

"Michelle and I send our warmest wishes to all those who will be celebrating the Lunar New Year this Sunday, February 10th.

Here in America and around the world, people of Asian and Pacific Islander descent will welcome the Year of the Snake.

In Chinese tradition, the snake represents wisdom, and a thoughtful approach to tackling the challenges before us – principles that I hope will continue to guide us as we perfect our union and create a more just and equal future for every American.

Our challenges may be great, but our diversity and the traditions that thrive here give us the strength to meet them. To everyone celebrating the Lunar New Year, I wish you peace, prosperity and good health and fortune."

http://www.whitehouse.gov/the-press-office/2013/02/08/statement-president-lunar-new-year

message: Mừng xuân Quý Tỵ 2013, AC mến chúc các bạn gần xa một năm mới thật nhiều niềm vui.  AC xin mượn lời chúc dí dỏm của Ngài Tổng Lãnh sự Lê Thành Ân gửi đến các bạn.  Chúc các bạn xinh đẹp như hoa Hồng, hạnh phúc như hoa Mai, thành công như hoa Cúc, phát tài như hoa Pháo, độc đáo như hoa Lan, an khang như hoa Huệ và trí tuệ như hoa Sen.  Mọi người ăn Tết vui vẻ nhé.

Mời các bạn xem phát biểu mừng xuân Quý Tỵ 2013 của Ngoại trưởng Kerry nhé. 
Statement by Secretary Kerry on 2013 Lunar New Year!

"On behalf of the American people, I am delighted to send my heartfelt wishes for good health, good fortune, happiness, and prosperity to all those around the world celebrating the arrival of the Lunar New Year this February 10." The Secretary of State's full statement can be found here: http://goo.gl/ZHMSh
2013 — Year of the Snake!  What are your plans for this new chapter in your life?
Mời các bạn xem đoạn video clip chương trình Talk Show thứ sáu tuần rồi. Đoạn clip do báo Thanh Niên thực hiện.  Happy Tet everyone!
Some fun for facebook fans before going to bed.  Good night everyone!

Hey, are you a fan of the Hunger Games?  This collection including books, audio books and DVDs are available at the American Center.  Check it out!

Today Feb. 6 is the 10th anniversary of the International Day of Zero Tolerance to Female Genital Mutilation/Cutting (FGM/C). At 9:30 p.m. tonight, join us in a live webcast of a panel of experts who will discuss successful efforts and solutions to address this issue.  https://conx.state.gov/digital-diplomacy/

An estimated 100 to 145 million women have undergone this brutal procedure, and about 3 million girls are at risk each year.

Dear AC friends, the American Center will be closed from Friday, February 8, 2013 through Monday, February 18, 2013 for Vietnamese Lunar New Year and American Presidents’ Day holidays. Normal business hours will be resumed on Tuesday, February 19, 2013. Happy Lunar New Year everyone!

message: Hi all, due to Tet holidays, there will be no Book Club in February.  The next book club will be on Tuesday, March 5, at 5:00 p.m.  We will discuss "To Build a Fire" by Jack London. Please read before joining the club.  You have plenty of time. http://www.jacklondons.net/buildafire.html

Happy Groundhog Day! Groundhog Day is a day celebrated on February 2. According to folklore, if it is cloudy when a groundhog emerges from its burrow on this day, then spring will come early; if it is sunny, the groundhog will supposedly see its shadow and retreat back into its burrow, and the winter weather will continue for six more weeks.  Find out more about Groundhog Day here http://www.groundhog.org/groundhog-day/about-groundhog-day/

February 2, 2013 is World Wetlands Day! This year's theme is "Wetlands take care of water," which alludes to the important role that wetlands play in issues such as improving water quality and alleviating floods. What does the theme mean to you?

message: Đừng quên Talk Show ngày mai lúc 2g nha mọi người.  Đây cũng là chương trình họp mặt cuối năm của AC đó.  Chúc các bạn ngủ ngon và hẹn gặp ngày mai!

Thông báo: chương trình Talk Show ngày thứ sáu, 1/2 lúc 2g sẽ có phần biểu diễn văn nghệ và thi hát karaoke.  Cá nhân hoặc nhóm nào dự định thi hát thì đăng ký với ban tổ chức nhé.  Gọi điện thoại số 3520-4629 hoặc gửi email tới ACHCMC@state.gov. Bạn nào có áo dài thì mặc cho vui. Đây sẽ là chương trình cuối cùng của năm con Rồng, qua năm con Rắn mình sẽ tiếp tục các hoạt động khác.  Cám ơn mọi người.

Các bạn đừng quên chương trình ngày mai, thứ năm 31/1,, lúc 2 giờ nhé.  Đề tài thật hấp dẫn phải không? Hẹn gặp mọi người nhé.

The American Center will be closed on Monday, January 21, in observance of the Martin Luther King, Jr. Day. The Power of Habit: Why We Do What We Do in Life and Business is a book by Charles Duhigg, a NY Times reporter. Published in February of 2012 by Random House, it explores the science behind habit creation and reformation. The book has reached the best seller list for NY Times, Amazon.com, USA Today and is now available at the American Center.  Check it out!

message: AC just added these great stories to our collection. Check them out! Good night everyone!

For nearly 80 years, January 20 has been the day of America’s presidential transition. Because the 20th falls on a Sunday in 2013, President Obama will take the oath of office January 20 in private. 
And a public inauguration ceremony will be held the next day on January 21. Read more here: http://iipdigital.usembassy.gov/st/english/article/2012/12/20121226140394.html#ixzz2HetAAEtc
Còn nhiều phim hay tại AC lắm, các bạn đã biết chưa? Cuối tuần hãy suy nghĩ xem thích phim gì để tuần sau ghé AC nhé. Chúc mọi người cuối tuần vui vẻ!
Laughter is timeless, imagination has no age, and dreams are forever!  Wish you all a nice weekend!

message:
Các bạn nhớ sắp xếp thời gian tham dự chương trình hấp dẫn "Today's Hollywood" chiều mai thứ sáu 11/1 lúc 2 giờ nhé. Sẵn dịp này AC giới thiệu với các bạn ba quyển sách về Hollywood và Los Angeles có sẵn ở thự viện AC nếu các bạn muốn tham khảo. Hẹn gặp mọi người chiều mai.

Today’s Hollywood

Time: Tuesday, Jan. 11, 2:00 p.m.
Venue: The American Center, 8th Floor, Diamond Plaza, 34 Le Duan Blvd., District 1, HCMC
Speaker: Mr. Nicholas Snyder, Consulate Officer

Hollywood is a district in Los Angeles, California, but its fame and cultural identity are worldwide. “Hollywood” has become a symbol for the American film and television industry. Come join Mr. Snyder, a former resident of Los Angeles, in finding out what’s new in today’s Hollywood.
How can a new technology, like the iPhone, be used to improve your daily life and your community? http://goo.gl/6BxUj

Each year since 1927 Time Magazine has published their “person of the year,” – the person they believe “for better or for worse, has done the most to influence the events of the year.” This year’s person is U.S. President Barack Obama, the second time he's been chosen! Do you agree with the magazine’s decision? Whom else would you nominate for his award?

message: Happy New Year! What are your wishes for 2013?
New York’s Times Square drops a New Year’s ball, but Raleigh, North Carolina, drops an enormous acorn. What New Year’s traditions do you have? http://goo.gl/BkO1L
While 2012 winds down, many Americans will take time during the holiday season to reflect upon the past year. As I look back on 2012, I do so with great pride.
Count down to New Year 2013!  What will you be doing?

The U.S. Embassy's Regional English Language Office in Bangkok is inviting English language teachers to join a free English Language Teaching Webinar, "Shaping the Way We Teach English." message: Hi all, don't forget Activities in English this afternoon with Mr. Ted Diehl.  See you all there!

Interactive Thanksgiving

On November 14, 2012, from 8:00-9:15 a.m. EST. please join us for a live, interactive Thanksgiving event featuring award-winning American chefs. This program will take place direct from Blair House, the President’s guest house. Chefs Art Smith, Sam Kass and Richard Hetzler from the National Museum of the American Indian will engage viewers around the world on how to prepare classic American dishes for Thanksgiving. From mouth-watering turkeys, to classic sweet potato pie, audiences will learn about the culinary traditions and food products that go into some of our favorite recipes. Chefs will also provide live commentary about the American tradition of Thanksgiving, including its history and role in our family lives.

Attention university students! Do you speak English, have an interest in protecting the environment, and want a chance to travel and learn in the US next summer? Please apply by for the 2013 SUSI for Student Leaders. All information here:

THE U.S. DEPARTMENT OF STATE PROFESSIONAL FELLOWS PROGRAM
“Vietnam and USA mid-level professionals exchange program: Mutual learning for economic empowerment in the context of business and government partnerships” 
Center for Public Service 
Mark. O. Hatfield School of Government 
Portland State University 
Portland, OREGON 

For more information, come to: http://hochiminh.usconsulate.gov/professional_fellows_program.html for English, and to: http://photos.state.gov/libraries/vietnam/171343/PDF/Program_Guidelines_CPSPSU-Vietnamese.pdf  for Vietnamese.

message:
Dear All,

The Vietnam Education Foundation (VEF) Fellowship Program, funded by the U.S. Government, brings Vietnamese nationals to the United States for graduate degree programs on the sciences (natural, physical, and environmental), technology (including information technology), engineering, mathematics, and medicine (including public health and health sciences). 

We are pleased to announce a new application cycle of the VEF Fellowship Program for the 2014 Cohort. There will be 45 Master's/Doctorate Fellowships with full financial support through a cost-sharing agreement between VEF and U.S. universities available.
Application form will be available online only at the VEF website at: www.vef.gov from 10:00 a.m., December 10, 2012 to 10:00 a.m., April 10, 2013 (Vietnam time zone).
For further details, please refer to the program announcement at: http://home.vef.gov/news.php?id=292

Announcement on Ac’s English Conversation Clubs

The results of last week’s English Placement Test are in! Due to high demand, we have decided to run two English Conversation Clubs.  The top scorers from the exam are invited to join Conversation Club A, which will meet on Thursdays from 5:00-6:30 pm.  The next tier of top scorers are invited to join Conversation Club B, which will meet on Tuesdays from 5:00-6:30 pm.  Congratulations to everyone who took the test – the results were impressive! Các bạn ơi!  Đã sẵng sàng cho lễ hội Halloween chưa? Thứ tư sắp đến rồi.  AC thân mời các bạn đã đăng ký và xác nhận đến dự lễ hội Halloween nhé.  Các bạn lưu ý thủ tục vào cổng sẽ được bắt đầu từ 4g.  Các bạn đi sớm chút để khỏi phải chờ đợi kiểm tra an ninh nhé. Hẹn gặp các bạn vào thứ tư.  Các bạn nào còn thắc mắc về việc đăng ký và tham dự thì gọi điện thoại đến AC số 3520-4629 để được giải đáp nhé.

Thông báo:

Do chương trình Halloween sẽ được tổ chức vào ngày thứ tư 31/10 nên tuần sau chương trình Activities in English thường lệ sẽ tạm hoãn nhé. Thư viện sẽ đóng cửa sớm vào 4 giờ ngày thứ tư vì AC phải làm thủ tục check-in cho các bạn tham gia Halloween.  Các bạn có tên trong danh sách tham gia Halloween vui lòng đi sớm từ 4g là có thể vào được rồi vì số lượng đông nếu các bạn đi cận giờ sẽ phải chờ đợi thủ tục an ninh rất lâu.  Vì có cả Ngài Tổng Lãnh sự và Phó Tổng Lãnh sự tham gia, chúng ta cần bắt đầu đúng giờ.  Các bạn nào cần thay đổi costumes thì có thể mang theo để thay tại AC nhé.  Chúc mọi người cuối tuần vui vẻ!

Halloween is mainly observed in the United States and in some provinces of Northern Mexico and in Canada. The word Halloween means “Night before All Saints’ Day”, reason why it is observed on the evening of October 31st; the festivity has its origins in the Day of All Saints. Are you ready for a Halloween party at the American Center? http://goo.gl/6uJy6

Lưu ý về chương trình Halloween:

AC sẽ gửi email xác nhận đến 160 bạn đăng ký trước và đăng ký mặc đồ hóa trang.  Khi nhận email các bạn vui lòng gửi xác nhận lại và cung cấp số chứng minh nhân dân.  Vì chương trình làm sau 7g tối nên phải tuân thủ các yêu cầu an ninh.  Nếu bạn nào không cung cấp số CMND thì sẽ không có tên trong danh sách xét duyệt của phòng an ninh.  Thêm nữa chương trình được thiết kế với giả thiết các bạn mặc đồ hóa trang như đã đăng ký.  Vậy các bạn nhớ mặc đồ hóa trang (càng sáng tạo càng vui, khuyến khích đồ tự chế) khi tham gia để chương trình vui và đạt hiệu quả nhất nhé.  Xin lỗi các bạn đăng ký trễ hoặc chưa kịp đăng ký.  Hẹn các bạn dịp khác nhé.
Our lovely moderator: Brian Neubert.  You will see him again on the 26th for Soft Skills Training on Leadership.

Các bạn nhớ thông báo dùm với những bạn không có facebook nhé.  Hẹn gặp mọi người lúc 3:30 chiều nay!
Happy World Food Day! This year’s theme, which was announced by the Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations, is “Agricultural Cooperatives: Key to Feeding the World.”

Today, October 15, people across the world celebrated Global Handwashing Day, an event aimed at increasing awareness and understanding that washing ones hands with soap is an effective and affordable way to prevent disease. Check out this cool Global Handwashing Day game! Have fun!
Các bạn nào không có dịp tham gia chương trình kỷ niệm một năm của trung tâm vào ngày 28/9 vừa qua thì xem đoạn clip ngắn này về hoạt động hôm ấy nhé.  Enjoy!
Register for AC's Halloween celebration on Wed., Oct. 31, 2012 at 5:00PM here please!

Các bạn yêu thích tranh luận, đừng quên tham gia chương trình đặc biệt này nhé.  Hai khách mời người Mỹ đại diện Đảng Dân chủ và Cộng hòa tại của Mỹ tại Việt Nam sẽ tham gia tranh luận mô phỏng theo cuộc tranh luận giữu hai ứng cử viên tổng thống tại Mỹ.  Các bạn sẽ được sống gần như thật với không khí tranh luận hào hứng, học hỏi được nhiều kỹ năng tranh luận cũng như có cơ hội giao lưu với các diễn giả.   Đừng bỏ lỡ nhé.  Sẽ có phần giao lưu hấp dẫn cho người tham dự nữa đấy. Chú ý giờ chương trình có phần đặc biệt do lịch làm việc của khách mời, đúng 3:30p.m. nhé!

Congratulations to “Empowering Women and Girls through Sports” Photo Contest finalists, chosen from more than 930 entries!
 
Two grand prize winners are Svetlana S. from Uzbekistan and Elizabeth S. from the United States. Make sure to check out all of the winning photos with the 18 runners-up (including the one from Vietnam)!

Thank you to everyone who participated in this year’s contest by submitting amazing photos of women and girls playing sports throughout the world. We are inspired by the moments you captured.

Watch the First U.S. Presidential Debate LIVE!  ---- Right NOW!
Thursday, October 4 
8:00-9:30 a.m. Thailand time 
Location: University of Denver, Denver, CO
Moderator:Jim Lehrer, Executive Editor of the PBS NewsHour
Format
The first presidential debate will focus on domestic policy, including economics, healthcare, and government. It will be divided into six segments of approximately 15 minutes each.
The moderator will open each segment with a question, after which each candidate will have two minutes to respond. The moderator will use the balance of the time in the segment for a discussion of the topic.

Announcing the 2013 Global Undergraduate Exchange Scholarship Program

The Public Affairs Section of the U.S. Embassy in Hanoi and Consulate General in Ho Chi Minh City are seeking candidates for the 2013 Global Undergraduate Exchange Program (Global UGRAD). First through third year undergraduate students who have demonstrated leadership through academic work, community involvement and extracurricular activities and with a good command of English are invited to apply for the program. The application deadline is 5 p.m. on November 26, 2012.

By being good environmental stewards, communities who live near rhino populations can increase their income in the form of tourism. “You can kill an animal, you might get the money from the animal once,” said Under Secretary of State Robert Hormats. “If you keep animals flourishing, then people come year after year.” Do you agree with his statement? http://goo.gl/hbCnJ

On Wednesday, August 22, the American Center Hanoi will select two questions posted by our Facebook friends to ask Ambassador Carden at Friday's event--both friends will receive a prize!

Today’s American English idiom is “the sky is the limit.” Use this idiom to when it seems nothing can stop people or organizations from achieving their dreams or succeeding. 
- When Julia was chosen to be on the Olympic swim team, it seemed like the sky was the limit.
- James felt like the sky was the limit when he received his university diploma.

message:
Use today’s American English idiom, “rise to the occasion,” when someone succeeds in an especially difficult or high-pressure situation.  You can rise to the occasion in sports, school, work, or your personal life.
 - The young Olympic hurdler rose to the occasion and set a new world record in front of millions of fans.
- Public speaking makes Becky nervous, but she rose to the occasion and made a great speech at the conference.
 Have you ever had to rise to the occasion?  What was the situation?

The American Center HCMC is pleased to announce that we are accepting applications for our newly launched “Youth and Volunteerism” program.  If selected, students will have the opportunity to attend a two day workshop on September 4 and 5, to learn about volunteerism in HCMC and visit local Non-governmental Organizations who are making a difference in the city.  In addition, students will be able to meet with volunteer minded individuals from the US Consulate General as well as members of the Vietnamese State Alumni Network and learn about opportunities for US exchanges.  Applications are due August 19.  See attached documents for more information and the application form.

This week’s American English idioms relate to track and field events.  In these sports, the “homestretch” is the last part of a race.  Runners see the finish line, but still have to work hard to get there.  Use today’s idiom, “in the homestretch,” to describe situations where you are close to completing a challenging task, goal, or project.    

- Almaz knew she was in the homestretch when she began writing the conclusion to her research paper.   
- I saw the final mile marker in the marathon and knew I was IN THE HOMESTRETCH.

Are you in the homestretch of finishing any projects or goals?

We hope you are enjoying the 2012 Olympics and that you “had a ball” with this week’s American English idioms!
 
Let’s review. Which idiom could you use these situations?
1.  You need to order food for a party, but aren’t 100% sure how many people will attend
2.  You are trying to reach a difficult goal 
3.  Your boss asked you to do something that you are very good at 
4.  You want to buy a house and you have offered a price to the seller   

Idioms:
A. keep your eye on the ball
B. the ball is in your court
C. ballpark estimate (ballpark figure, ballpark number)
D. slam dunk

[Note: “have a ball” = enjoy, have fun]

International Youth Day 2012

Calling all young world changers! August 12 is International Youth Day!  To mark this event and launch its new Facebook page, the Office of Global Youth Issues is invited young people from around the world to share with them a challenge young people in their country face and what they are doing to help solve the problem.  If you want to help represent Vietnam in this project, make a 30-90 second video telling us who you are, where you are from, a problem you see in your community and what youth are doing to help solve that problem. Submit your videos to ACHCMC@state.gov by Friday August 10 and we’ll submit them to the Office of Global Youth Issues’ Youtube channel.
Bạn nào muốn tìm hiểu thêm về cuộc thi rất phổ biến ở Mỹ Spelling Bee thì lên AC xem cuốn phim này nhé!

Today’s American English idiom is “slam dunk.” Off the basketball court, you will hear this phrase used to describe situations where a successful outcome is expected.

Examples:

- Janet has strong grades and test scores, so getting into a good university will be a slam dunk.

- Swimmer Michael Phelps holds many world records, so winning another Olympic medal should be a slam dunk.

Will winning a medal in the Olympics be a slam dunk for your favorite team or athlete? In which sport?

Idiom for today: When you are not 100% certain and need to give approximate information, use today's American English idiom: “ballpark estimate.”  Two similar phrases are “ballpark number” and ‘ballpark figure.” 

Examples:

- Can you give me a ballpark estimate on how long it will take to finish the construction? 

- As a ballpark number, I’d guess 10,000 people attended the soccer match.

Have you ever given or asked for a ballpark estimate?  What was the situation?
AC mới có nhiều phim hay quá nè các bạn ơi! Sẽ lần lượt giới thiệu với các bạn mỗi tuần.  Enjoy!

Today's American English idiom relates to tennis. If you are negotiating, telling people “the ball is in your court” lets them know it is their turn to act or make a decision.    

Examples:

- I told my son he could go to the movies if he cleans up his room first.  The ball is in his court.

- Katie offered us a good price for the car we want to sell, so the ball is in our court.

Can you think of another phrase in English or your language that has the same meaning?

message: It's Harry Potter's birthday! In America, he made a big difference in children's literacy. Did Harry Potter have an effect on your reading habits?

Let’s “play ball” with this week’s American English idioms! Use the phrase "keep your eye on the ball" to talk about staying focused on a goal and paying attention to details.

Examples:

- If you want to succeed in this competitive industry, you have to keep your eye on the ball.

- If he wants to go a good university, Frank needs to keep his eye on the ball and study more.

When do you need to keep your eye on the ball?

(Photo credit: Richard Paul Kane / Shutterstock.com)

Today is Global Tiger Day! Did you know that the Siberian, or Amur, tiger is one of the most critically endangered of all tiger subspecies? Approximately 350-400 Siberian tigers remain in the Russian Far East. Although numbers have gone up slightly in recent years, Siberian tigers remain threatened by poaching, habitat destruction, and disease. Learn more at: http://www.fs.fed.us/global/globe/europe/russia.htm#5

The 2012 Olympics are almost here!  This week’s American English idioms are related to boxing. Today’s idiom is “low blow,” which is an unfair or unsportsmanlike act. This phrase and another boxing idiom, “hit below the belt,” relate to rules that state a boxer can’t hit an opponent below the waist. 
Examples:

- My sister told my friends that I didn't get the new job. What a low blow!

- You don’t want to get in an argument with her!  She says hurtful things that really hit below the belt. 

What qualities make something a “low blow”?  When could you use this expression?

Learn more about Colorado here.

Congratulations to the members of the 20 teams selected to compete in Presenting: Great States!  

Here’s a little reminder of the competition rules:

• Presentations must be 5 minutes long. Once your five minutes are over, we will move on to the next group even if your presentation is not finished.
• You may have all members of your group speak, or only a few.  It’s up to you!
• You must present only on your assigned state.
• You should tell us about tourism, geography, culture, or anything else interesting about your state.
• Your must use Microsoft PowerPoint for your presentation.
• You must submit your PowerPoint file to achcmc@state.gov by 5:00PM on July 19th, 2012.
• Groups will present in the order listed in the attachment, beginning at 2:00PM on July 20th, 2012.
• At the end of the presentations, the audience will vote for their five favorite presentations.
• The top five presentations will be uploaded to Facebook to compete for the grand prize
• The three teams with the most votes on Facebook will be awarded prizes at the ceremony on Friday, July 27th at 2:00PM.

Please see the list of 20 selected teams here:

Happy Fourth of July! In 1776 U.S. Founding Father John Adams famously predicted that Independence Day would be celebrated "with pomp and parade, with shows, games, sports, guns, bells, bonfires, and illuminations, from this time forward forever more."

Hi all, our next stop on July 4 is Washington, D.C. — The U.S. congress designated Washington, D.C., the capital of the United States when it signed the Residence Act on July 16, 1790.

Watch live video of the July 4 Fireworks in Washington DC at 20:00 EDT (Midnight July 5, GMT)

Learn about visiting Washington, D.C.at http://goo.gl/Ha4s7
50 States in 50 Days: You’ve heard of Silicon Valley, but have you heard of the Silicon Forest? This high tech area lies just outside of Portland, Oregon.

The U.S. Consulate HCMC is co-sponsoring a conference on technology and entrepreneurship from  July 4-7th.  Strategic Alliance Vietnamese Ventures Inc. (SAVVi) designed the Technology, Entrepreneurship, and Creative Mix (TECx) to examine how technology is transforming our lives.   The four main themes of the conference are media, healthcare, biotech/agriculture, and education.  Click here for more information on this opportunity to network with industry leaders:  http://savvi.bz/savvi/index.php?page=tbc

Our stop today is Minnesota.  Minnesota - the state's name comes from a Dakota Indian word for "sky-tinted water" - is known as the "Land of 10,000 Lakes." The actual number, however, is closer to 12,000, and those waters, together with forests, parks, and wilderness areas, offer visitors a variety of outdoor activities.

THÔNG BÁO
CUỘC THI THUYẾT TRÌNH

Các bạn quan tâm AC như thế nào? Các bạn đánh giá dịch vụ của AC như thế nào? Các bạn mong muốn điều gì ở AC? Các bạn muốn nâng cao hay tăng thêm dịch vụ gì ở AC?...

Đó là những điều AC băn khoăn và cần các bạn chia sẻ. Vậy các bạn hãy dành chút thời gian hoàn thiện bản khảo sát trực tuyến theo link này, và submit trước ngày 13/7/2012 nhé.

AC rất cảm ơn những đánh giá của các bạn.
Iowa — The next stop on our tour of the United States is Iowa. Iowa ratified the U.S. Constitution on December 28, 1846, to become the 29th state in the union.

Texas — Is nicknamed the Lone Star State after the single star represented on its state flag. 

Learn about visiting Texas and other states at http://goo.gl/TGfFq

Hôm nay chia tay cô Danette buồn quá nhưng bù lại mọi người đã có một buổi sinh họat thật vui và ý nghĩa.  Chúng ta mong gặp lại Danette một ngày gần đây. Các bạn ơi, hãy cùng chúc Danette nhiều may mắn và thành công trong nhiệm kỳ mới nhé.  Chắc chắn Danette sẽ rất vui khi đọc lời chúc của các bạn trên facebook đó!

message:
50 States in 50 Days: General Motors, Ford, and Chrysler all started in Detroit, Michigan. What kind of car would you like to own?
http://goo.gl/IEbAu

Let's visit Florida today!  Have you always wondered how it would feel to be an astronaut?  Visit Florida's Kennedy Space Center and you can experience what a space launch feels like. Learn more at http://goo.gl/D2hyf

Thứ tư này là buổi sinh hoạt cuối cùng của cô Danette với mình đó.  Tụi mình sẽ có một buổi liên hoan nho nhỏ để chia tay Danette.  Các bạn yêu quí Danette nhớ sắp xếp thời gian tham dự nha! Mong gặp mọi người!
Ngoài chương trình ngày thứ ba 26/6 do ngài Phó Tổng Lãnh sự phụ trách, AC còn có chương trình này nữa nè. Các bạn đừng quên nhé!

AC gửi lời chào đầu tuần đến mọi người nhé.  Hôm nay mình tiếp tục thăm bang Arkansas nha.  Các bạn có biết Wal-mart một trong những công ty bán lẻ lớn nhất trên thế giới có trụ sở chính tại Bang Arkansas này đó. Thành lập từ năm 1962, Wal-mart hiện đã có 9000 cửa hàng trên toàn thế giới.  Bang Arkansas còn có nickname là “The Natural State” vì ở đây có rừng tự nhiên cổ nhất nước Mỹ.  Các bạn vào link dưới đây để biết thêm thông tin về bang này nhé.  Chúc mọi người một tuần làm việc hiệu quả!

Chúc mừng bạn Lê Uyên, fan thứ 4000 của American Center facebook! Các bạn hãy tiếp tục ủng hộ facebook của trung tâm và giới thiệu cho bạn bè của mình nhé.  Nhiều bất ngờ thú vị đang chờ đón các bạn đó!
How many languages do you speak?.... A degree in Modern Languages can be a passport to the world as you will be able to interact with local communities and find job opportunities overseas...

Hello everyone! Today, we are going to visit Missouri.  Mark Twain, the “father of American Literature” used his home state of Missouri as the setting for his famous novels “The Adventures of Tom Sawyer” and it’s sequel “Adventures of Huckleberry Finn.” AC has this novel and film.  Come and check it out!
http://goo.gl/Ck4IO

Good sunday morning!  Today, let's meet the Flying Monkeys, a Girl Scout troop that designed a prosthetic hand advice for a four year old with no fingers. Their advice to youth who want to create a sustainable future is "Get an idea you are passionate about and start testing it out." Do you agree with this statement?  
http://goo.gl/0QvoP
Hi all, here is an interesting program for all of you.  Dont miss it!

Chào buổi sáng mọi người!  Một tuần trôi qua nhanh quá.  Hôm nay thứ bảy nữa rồi, mình sẽ khám phá tiểu bang Maine nhé. Manie nằm xa nhất phía Đông Bắc nước Mỹ, sát bên bờ Đại Tây Dương với phía Đông gồm rất nhiều vịnh và đảo lớn nhỏ.  Maine là bang duy nhất có đường biên giới giáp với đúng một bang khác, nổi tiếng với bãi biển đá và hơn 60 ngọn hải đăng dọc theo bờ biển.  Hãy tìm hiều thêm về bang này và thư giãn cuối tuần nhé mọi người!.

message: 50 states in 50 days – Alabama: Located in the country's deep south, Alabama boasts great beaches on the Gulf of Mexico, premier NASCAR auto racing at the Talladega Superspeedway, and the Civil Rights Trail marking the achievements of Martin Luther King, Jr., Rosa Parks, and other pioneers of the Civil Rights movement of the 1960s.
Các bạn ơi, đừng quên chương trình the U.S. Peace Corps với Mr. Ray Nayler ngày mai lúc 2 giờ nhé.  Hẹn gặp mọi người!

50 states in 50 days - Illinois – known as the Land of Lincoln – is home to many places important to the life of Abraham Lincoln, including his home and his tomb, both in the state capital of Springfield. Close by is New Salem, shown here, a ‘living history’ reconstruction of the frontier village where in the 1830s the young Lincoln lived and worked.

June 20 is World Refugee Day.

Refugees often face challenges when resettling in a new country, but many overcome these obstacles and achieve success. Here are examples of famous (and not-so-famous) refugees who went on to make a difference in their local communities and beyond. Take a look at this photo gallery of refugees who became successful in the United States.
Do you know what the "Juneteenth" holiday signifies?

message:
50 States 50 Days - Oxford, Mississippi is home to literary artist William Faulkner and the ever-popular University of Mississippi, also known as "Ole Miss." Find more about Mississippi at
 http://goo.gl/al0OF

Can't make it to Washington to see the White House in person? Thanks to the White House and the Google Art Project, anyone with an Internet connection can take a virtual tour of the president's home. What famous buildings would you most like to tour?

Hello mọi người!  Hôm nay thứ ba, mình đi khám phá tiểu bang tiếp theo là Indiana nhé. Đi thăm Indiana’s Bluespring Caverns nổi tiếng nhé. Mỗi ngày AC sẽ mang đến cho các bạn thông tin thú vị về một tiểu bang của Mỹ.  Trong 50 ngày, các bạn sẽ biết hết về 50 tiểu bang ở Mỹ đó.  Enjoy!

Các bạn ơi, đến hôm nay AC đã có 4000 fans rồi đó.  Cám ơn các bạn fan thật nhiều nhé.  Mời bạn Lê Uyên, fan thứ 4000 đến AC nhận quà.  AC có một phần quà lưu niệm cho bạn.

Các bạn hãy tiếp tục đồng hành với AC facebook nhé và hãy chia sẻ với bạn bè của mình. AC facebook sẽ mang đến nhiều bất ngờ thú vị cho các bạn đó. Hãy nhớ tháng 9 là sinh nhật của AC facebook đó nghe, rủ rê thêm nhiều bạn bè để mình kỷ niệm sinh nhật thật vui nhé.  Chúc các bạn một ngày làm việc và học tập hiệu quả!
Congratulation to the new members of our Poetry Clubs and English Conversation Club. Please find your names in the list below. See you there!

Good Monday morning everyone!  Hope you had a good weekend and will start your new week with full energy.  Today, we are going to explore Louisiana. Do you know that New Orleans, Louisiana is known as the birth place of Jazz music. Check this link for more information.
http://www.discoveramerica.com/usa/states/louisiana.aspx

Good Sunday morning!  Hope you all have a lovely Sunday.  Let's discover Ohio today! Who is the American rock star you like the most? 

The Rock and Roll Hall of Fame in Cleveland, Ohio has exhibits from Elvis to Bruce Springsteen and the "Women Who Rock."  This museum is a great stop to learn about pop culture in the U.S.
Happy Father’s Day! How do you celebrate your father?
Chương trình đươc nhiều bạn mong đợi đây. AC nhận được rất nhiều yêu cầu cho chương trình này.  Các bạn sẽ gặp lại Mr. Ray Nayler đó.  Đừng bỏ lỡ nhé.
Khách mời của AC, ông Jason Keum sẽ là speaker của chương trình đầy mùi vị âm nhạc này nhé.

Các bạn đừng quên DVD English Fun thứ tứ lúc 5 giờ nhé.  Đây sẽ là chương trình DVD English Fun cuối cùng của cô Danette đó. Các bạn yêu mến Danette thì đừng bỏ lỡ hai chương trình cuối này nhé.

Các bạn ơi chương trình mới thứ ba tuần sau nè! Đừng quên nhé.  AC có nhiều chương trình tuần sau lắm đó.

Chào buổi sáng mọi người.  Hôm nay thứ bảy, mình sẽ đến thăm tiểu bang Tennessee, tham quan Great Smoky Mountains National Park, một vườn quốc gia và di sản thế giới tại Hoa Kỳ.  Đây là vườn quốc gia được tham quan nhiều nhất tại Hoa Kỳ. Chúc các bạn cuối tuần vui vẻ nhé!
Hi all, AC will host a program on Global Economic Statecraft on Tuesday, June 19, at 2:00 p.m. Come join us!

50 States in 50 Days: Kentucky isn’t all about horses and the Kentucky Derby: it also has 52 state parks and historic sites!  Do you take vacations to see environmental wonders like parks and waterfalls? U.S. President Lincoln was born in Kentucky! Find out more about Kentucky at:http://goo.gl/HxV7f

message:
Đại sứ quán Hoa Kỳ kỷ niệm Ngày Tài năng Quản trị Kinh tế Toàn cầu

Hà Nội, 14/6/2012 – Kể từ khi bình thường hoá quan hệ vào năm 1995, Việt Nam và Hoa Kỳ đã đạt tiến bộ to lớn trong việc củng cố tương lai kinh tế chung của hai nước. Ngày 14/6 là dịp kỷ niệm Ngày Tài năng Quản trị Kinh tế Toàn cầu, một sự kiện trên toàn thế giới do Bộ Ngoại giao Hoa Kỳ tổ chức nhằm nêu bật những công việc quan trọng liên quan đến kinh tế của các nhà ngoại giao và các chuyên gia phát triển của Hoa Kỳ trên khắp thế giới. Xem thông điệp của Bộ trưởng Clinton về tài năng quản trị nhà nước trong lĩnh vực kinh tế qua đường link này: http://video.state.gov/en/video/1684263865001

50 States in 50 Days: Vermont is home to Ben and Jerry, the creators of world famous Ben and Jerry’s Ice Cream!  Their many creative flavors include Phish Food, Cherry Garcia, and Late Night Snack and are part of the brand’s personality.  If you had the opportunity to name your own flavor of ice cream, what would call it?

Nếu bạn đang có kế hoạch đi du lịch Mỹ thì click vào đây để xem thêm thông tin nhé. Nhiều thông tin thú vị lắm đó.

Các bạn tối qua nghe bài hát "Land of Dreams" hay không?  Hôm nay mình khám phá tiếp tiểu bang nhỏ nhất nước Mỹ nhé.  Rhode Island!

50 States in 50 Days:  Rhode Island, the smallest state in the United States, has over 400 miles of pristine coastline and 20% of the country’s Historic Landmarks.  Keeping beaches clean is a difficult task: have you ever participated in a beach clean-up?

Mời các bạn nghe bài hát hay nè. Bài hát “Land of Dreams” được sáng tác và trình bày bởi ca sĩ Mỹ Rosane Cash cho chiến dịch “Khám phá nước Mỹ”. Bài hát và đoạn video ngắn giới thiệu những địa danh nổi tiếng của Mỹ từ New Orleans đến California. Các bạn hãy thưởng thức đi nhé. Chúc mọi người một buổi tối vui vẻ.

Hi all,

Hy vọng hôm nay mọi người làm bài thi tốt.  Các bạn đừng quên “Activities in English” ngày mai với cô Marjon Kamrani nhé.  Hẹn gặp mọi người lúc 5 giờ nhé.

50 States in 50 Days. North Carolina is home to one of America’s greatest mysteries, Roanoke Island. A group of about 120 British immigrants established a settlement on Roanoke Island, in North Carolina’s fabled Outer Banks. The colony not only failed, but disappeared. Many settlers came to the U.S. for economic and religious reasons.
Today is World Day Against Child Labor.  Do you know that millions of children in the world are exploited for their labor. Is there something you can do?

50 States in 50 Days: New York’s Adirondack is the largest park in the continental United States, and is legally protected to remain “forever wild.”  A top tourist destination, you can see New York City from the top of Rockefeller Center or the Empire State Building.  Which of these famous landmarks would you most like to see:

- Statue of Liberty

- Central Park

- Yankee Stadium

- Broadway

- The Metropolitan Museum of Art

50 States in 50 Days - Virginia’s Luray Caverns combines music and nature with the world’s largest organ.  While The Great Stalacpipe Organ is played from a regular-sized organ, the pipes are actually stalactites that spread over three-and-a-half acres underground!  In Virginia, you can also visit the home of George Washington, Mount Vernon! George Washington, America’s first president, built most of Mount Vernon by hand.

South Carolina is known for its beaches and golf courses, and it has both in abundance. From the busy Myrtle Beach area to the seclusion of Hilton Head Island, the coastline of South Carolina offers sand, surf and recreation—including more than 350 championship golf courses across the state. The welcoming city of Charleston has some of the country’s best restaurants, where ‟lowcountry” cuisine and fresh seafood shine, plus lovely antebellum (pre-Civil War) homes (many of which are open to visitors). It is also a jumping off point for the Civil War landmark Fort Sumter. http://www.discoveramerica.com/usa/states/south-carolina.aspx
Are you planning for a trip to the United States? Check out this link.  The Atlantic takes a humorous look at traveler guide books for visitors of the United States.

50 States in 50 Days - New Hampshire has four environmentally-themed nicknames.  Which one is your favorite: Granite State, Mother of Rivers, White Mountain State, or Switzerland of America?
http://goo.gl/VU4o3

message: Let's go to Maryland today.  Home to Vice President Spiro Agnew, home-run hitter Babe Ruth and antislavery activist Harriet Tubman, Maryland was the seventh state to join the union on April 28, 1788. Learn more about the state that inspired “The Star-Spangled Banner.

Happy World Oceans Day! This year’s theme is Youth: the Next Wave for Change.  On June 8, people around the planet celebrate and honor the body of water which connect us all. Maggy Benson from the Smithsonian Institute said, "The first step to take is to learn about the ocean and to understand it so we can than better protect it." Do you agree with her?  
http://bit.ly/L1fXOf

Visit America: It’s easier than you think!

More than 65 million visitors visit American each year.  Check this video to learn more about visa application procedures and start planning for your summer vacation!

Do you think of the invention of smart phones as a minnovation or an innovation? What is your favorite Smart Phone? 
A) Iphone
B) Droid
C) Nokia
D) Tell us your favorite…

Steve Jobs owned hundreds of patents for designs that gave Apple products a distinctive identity. An exhibit of Steve Jobs’ patents in the Smithsonian highlights the importance of intellectual property protection to a thriving entrepreneurial culture.

message:
Hi friends, what do you do to relax after a long week at work?
A. Hang out with friends
B. Play music

The choices we make, for good or ill, may well shape the state of the Union for generations yet to come." President John F. Kennedy, 1963

Here are highlights from 10 State of the Union speeches spanning 60 years, from Harry Truman in 1950 to Barack Obama in 2010. Which of these excerpts is most relevant today?

Chúc Mừng Năm Mới!
 
Đối với người Việt, lời chúc năm mới này gợi nhớ những kỷ niệm tuyệt vời, là khi chúng ta cùng đón Tết với gia đình và bè bạn, cúng rước ông bà tổ tiên và thưởng thức những truyền thống từ ngàn xưa.  Lời chúc Tết này còn đem đến niềm hy vọng, sự lạc quan và ước nguyện về một năm mới thịnh vượng sắp đến.  Là người Mỹ gốc Việt, tôi và Chi Tâm, vợ tôi, cũng từng lớn lên với những truyền thống đó. Sau nhiều năm đón tết với gia đình và cộng đồng người Việt ở hải ngoại, chúng tôi rất hân hạnh được cùng đón tết, cái tết thứ hai trên cương vị Tổng Lãnh sự tại thành phố Hồ Chí Minh, với tất cả các bạn.
 
Thay mặt tất cả các đồng nghiệp trong Tổng Lãnh sự quán, tôi xin chúc tất cả các bạn một năm Nhâm Thìn hạnh phúc, an khang và thịnh vượng.


Chúc Mừng Năm Mới!
 
For Vietnamese, this New Year greeting evokes wonderful memories of sharing Tet holidays with family and friends, honoring ancestors, and enjoying ancient traditions.  It also elicits hope, optimism and anticipation for a prosperous year ahead.  As Americans of Vietnamese descent, my wife, Chi Tam, and I grew up with these same traditions.  After years of celebrating Tet with family and Vietnamese communities abroad, it is a special honor and privilege for us to be able to share this, our second Tet as U.S. Consul General in Ho Chi Minh City, with you all. 
 
On behalf of all of my colleagues at the U.S. Consulate General in Ho Chi Minh City, I wish everyone happiness, prosperity and health in 2012- the Year of the Dragon.

The American Center Poetry and English Conversation Clubs 

The American Center is pleased to announce a Poetry Club and an English Conversation Club starting in February. Both clubs will run for ten weeks, then be opened to new members. 

Participants are requested to take a basic English test to become members of these two clubs. The test schedule is: 

English Test for Poetry Club: Tuesday, January 17, at 5:00 p.m. 

English Test for English Conversation Club: Tuesday, January 17, at 5:30 p.m. 

Everyone is welcome to take both tests. Selected candidates will be notified by email. 

Don’t miss this chance to test your English ability and become AC club members.
http://goo.gl/VqU80

Hi AC friends, dont forget to attend AC English test to become members of the Poetry Club and English Conversation Club.  Tuesday, Jan. 17, 5:00 p.m.: test for poetry club, 5:30 p.m.: Test for English Conversation Club. No registration is required.  See you all there.
